Monday: 9:00 am-Late Tuesday: 9:00 am-Late Wednesday: 9:00 am-Late Thursday: 9:00 am-Late Friday: 9:00 am-1:00 am Saturday: 9:00 am-1:00 am Sunday: 9:00 am-11:00 pm Website Instagram Facebook Show on map Activities Entertainment Activities Looking for fun in Auckland’s city centre? Timezone is making a bold return to Queen Street with its grand opening on 9 August 2025 . Spanning 1,200 square metres, this vibrant venue brings back the magic to its iconic location after six years. Whether you're a student needing a break, a family out for the weekend, young professionals unwinding after work, or couples planning a date night—Timezone has it all. Think Karaoke booths, Dance Dance Revolution, Maximum Tune 6, epic claw machines and so much more. It’s the ultimate hangout for all ages—packed with games, energy, and good times. Get $2.50 parking per hour to a maximum of $15.50 on evenings and weekends at the Downtown car park . Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Learn the skills used by the Wētā Workshop crew in these workshops which feature themes of horror, fantasy and sci-fi and give you the opportunity to unleash your creative lunacy upon the world. Wētā Workshop Unleashed Creative Workshop Combos Experience what it’s like to be a practical effects artist working on the movies, creating ghastly prosthetic effects for a variety of scenes. Wētā Workshop Unleashed & Fantasy Creative Workshop Combo Wētā Workshop Unleashed & Horror Creative Workshop Combo Wētā Workshop Unleashed & Intro into special effects combo At this 'Intro into special effects' creative workshop, the Wētā Workshop Unleashed crew will teach you the basic tricks of the trade to deliver realistic prosthetic effects that will make your friends and family cringe in terror, and giggle with horrified delight. Wētā Workshop Unleashed & Intro into special effects Combo $2.50 per hour to a max of $12.50 on weekends and a $12.50 flat rate for weekday evenings at The Civic car park. Find out more . Activities Lessons Federal & Elliott Federal Street Go for the Unexpected $$ Last updated: 07 November 2023 Add to favourites In the neighbourhood Federal & Elliott Wētā Workshop Unleashed Step into a fantastical film effects workshop and explore the worlds of horror, sci-fi and fantasy in-the-making. Add to favourites Federal & Elliott All Blacks Experience A fully guided, state-of-the-art, interactive experience celebrating the All Blacks and our national teams in black. Add to favourites Federal & Elliott Masu by Nic Watt With Chef Nic Watt at the helm, head to MASU for world class Japanese cuisine in the style of a robata restaurant and bar. ... Add to favourites Federal & Elliott Metita Michael Meredith is joining the SkyCity dining precinct with a new Pacific inspired restaurant, opening this October! Learn the skills used by the Wētā Workshop crew in these workshops which feature themes of horror, fantasy and sci-fi and give you the opportunity to unleash your creative lunacy upon the world. Wētā Workshop Unleashed Creative Workshop Combos Experience what it’s like to be a practical effects artist working on the movies, creating ghastly prosthetic effects for a variety of scenes. Wētā Workshop Unleashed & Fantasy Creative Workshop Combo Wētā Workshop Unleashed & Horror Creative Workshop Combo Wētā Workshop Unleashed & Intro into special effects combo At this 'Intro into special effects' creative workshop, the Wētā Workshop Unleashed crew will teach you the basic tricks of the trade to deliver realistic prosthetic effects that will make your friends and family cringe in terror, and giggle with horrified delight. Wētā Workshop Unleashed & Intro into special effects Combo $2.50 per hour to a max of $12.50 on weekends and a $12.50 flat rate for weekday evenings at The Civic car park. Find out more . Activities Lessons Federal & Elliott Federal Street Go for the Unexpected $$ Last updated: 07 November 2023 Add to favourites In the neighbourhood Federal & Elliott Wētā Workshop Unleashed Step into a fantastical film effects workshop and explore the worlds of horror, sci-fi and fantasy in-the-making. Add to favourites Federal & Elliott All Blacks Experience A fully guided, state-of-the-art, interactive experience celebrating the All Blacks and our national teams in black. Add to favourites Federal & Elliott Masu by Nic Watt With Chef Nic Watt at the helm, head to MASU for world class Japanese cuisine in the style of a robata restaurant and bar. ... Add to favourites Federal & Elliott Metita Michael Meredith is joining the SkyCity dining precinct with a new Pacific inspired restaurant, opening this October! From video to redemption to prize to VR. From old school to the latest technology. Dance, simulator, music, claw games and everything in between. Featuring a huge selection of games, a party room and prize shop with hundreds of prizes to choose from. Good for all weather and all occasions from corporate function to birthday party. Package deals and discounts available. Located within Auckland's pre-eminent entertainment center, combine your visit with the many other attractions all under one roof, including movies, bowling, sensory maze, minigolf and dining. $2.50 per hour to a max of $12.50 on weekends and a $12.50 flat rate for weekday evenings at The Civic car park. Enjoy amazing waterfront views, quality brews & delicious eats Add to favourites 204 Quay Street, Opening hours Currently closed Monday: 11:00 am-11:00 pm Tuesday: 11:00 am-11:00 pm Wednesday: 11:00 am-Late Thursday: 11:00 am-Late Friday: 11:00 am-3:00 am Saturday: 11:00 am-3:00 am Sunday: 11:00 am-10:00 pm Website Facebook Email Show on map Bars and Nightlife Happy Hour If you're looking for a fun place to relax and unwind with some cold beers and a breathtaking view of Auckland's Viaduct Harbour then you have to check out Dr. Rudi's Rooftop Beer Brewing Co. The atmosphere at Dr. Rudi's personifies the classic European Beer Hall with lots of open space for beer and snacks. The menu consists of sharing platters and pizzas, and Dr. Rudi's large deck offers the perfect place to enjoy a cold brew and plenty of sunshine with your friends. Dr. Rudi's also has live entertainment with DJs spinning tracks Thursday - Saturday till late. If you're looking for more than just music you can also check out their awesome tenpin bowling lane which makes for a very original time out. Flat fee of $7.50 per day on weekends at Fanshawe Street carpark. Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Monday: 9:00 am-8:00 pm Tuesday: 9:00 am-8:00 pm Wednesday: 9:00 am-8:00 pm Thursday: 9:00 am-8:00 pm Friday: 9:00 am-8:00 pm Saturday: 10:00 am-5:00 pm Sunday: 10:00 am-5:00 pm Website Request a booking Email Show on map Activities Entertainment Activities The Makerspace at Central City Library is an innovative hub offering a range of tools and resources for individuals of all ages to get creative. Whether you're interested in 3D design, sewing, video editing or 3D printing, the Makerspace provides a welcoming environment for exploration. If you need assistance, book a free one-on-one session with a knowledgeable staff member who can offer guidance and support. 3D printers The library's 3D printers can turn a digital model into a real-world object! Request a booking for the Ultimaker 2+ or Ultimaker 3 ($4-$6) here . Sewing equipment Sewing machine: the library's Singer Heavy Duty 4411 is perfect for any sewing project! Request a booking to use it for free, here . Overlocker: use the Singer Finishing Touch overlocker to hem, seam, and tidy your textile projects for a professional finish! Request a booking to use it for free here . Embroidery Machine: use the Brother NV180 embroidery machine to create good looking, long-lasting embroidered patterns and patches for your clothes! The Makerspace team can teach you how to convert any image to an embroidery pattern, and you'll be personalising clothes in no time. Request a booking to use it for free, here . Makerspace computers Make the most of the libraries special Makerspace Computers, loaded with a range of creative software to get your imagination working. The software is all open-source, which means you can also download it at home for free! No bookings needed, but you can request help from staff in advance using this form . The software includes 2D art and design, 3D design, music production, coding and game development, video editing, and more! Makerspace table The big table at the Makerspace can be booked for public workshops, creative clubs, or big projects. To request a booking, email here . You can find more Makerspaces at other Libraries! Find out more here . (Services vary from Makerspace to Makerspace). $2.50 per hour to a max of $12.50 on weekends and a $12.50 flat rate for weekday evenings at The Civic car park. Find out more . Monday: 9:00 am-8:00 pm Tuesday: 9:00 am-8:00 pm Wednesday: 9:00 am-8:00 pm Thursday: 9:00 am-8:00 pm Friday: 9:00 am-8:00 pm Saturday: 10:00 am-5:00 pm Sunday: 10:00 am-5:00 pm Website Request a booking Email Show on map Activities Entertainment Activities The Makerspace at Central City Library is an innovative hub offering a range of tools and resources for individuals of all ages to get creative. Whether you're interested in 3D design, sewing, video editing or 3D printing, the Makerspace provides a welcoming environment for exploration. If you need assistance, book a free one-on-one session with a knowledgeable staff member who can offer guidance and support. 3D printers The library's 3D printers can turn a digital model into a real-world object! Request a booking for the Ultimaker 2+ or Ultimaker 3 ($4-$6) here . Sewing equipment Sewing machine: the library's Singer Heavy Duty 4411 is perfect for any sewing project! Request a booking to use it for free, here . Overlocker: use the Singer Finishing Touch overlocker to hem, seam, and tidy your textile projects for a professional finish! Request a booking to use it for free here . Embroidery Machine: use the Brother NV180 embroidery machine to create good looking, long-lasting embroidered patterns and patches for your clothes! The Makerspace team can teach you how to convert any image to an embroidery pattern, and you'll be personalising clothes in no time. Request a booking to use it for free, here . Makerspace computers Make the most of the libraries special Makerspace Computers, loaded with a range of creative software to get your imagination working. The software is all open-source, which means you can also download it at home for free! No bookings needed, but you can request help from staff in advance using this form . The software includes 2D art and design, 3D design, music production, coding and game development, video editing, and more! Makerspace table The big table at the Makerspace can be booked for public workshops, creative clubs, or big projects. To request a booking, email here . You can find more Makerspaces at other Libraries! Find out more here . (Services vary from Makerspace to Makerspace). $2.50 per hour to a max of $12.50 on weekends and a $12.50 flat rate for weekday evenings at The Civic car park. Find out more . But here's the real kicker: the studio offers instant polaroid images that print out right after the session! It's like the old-school cool of the 90s mixed with the tech of today. Plus, the range of fun and playful props will make sure everyone is having a blast while they're at it. Why settle for boring, stuffy pics when you can capture your unique style in a snap? Park for $2.50 per hour, to a maximum of $10.50 on evenings and weekends at the Victoria St car park. Find out more . But here's the real kicker: the studio offers instant polaroid images that print out right after the session! It's like the old-school cool of the 90s mixed with the tech of today. Plus, the range of fun and playful props will make sure everyone is having a blast while they're at it. Why settle for boring, stuffy pics when you can capture your unique style in a snap? Park for $2.50 per hour, to a maximum of $10.50 on evenings and weekends at the Victoria St car park. Find out more . Te Ao Pūtahi Festival Te Manaaki, Auckland's Giant Christmas Tree Main menu (Mega) Events Today Tomorrow This Week This Weekend What's On This Month Food & Drink Events Festivals Theatre Exhibitions Music Events Dining Breakfast Lunch Dinner Dessert Cafés Cheap Eats Chinese Korean Japanese Vegan & Vegetarian Bars & Nightlife Bars Open Air Bars Happy Hour Pubs Clubs Live Music Shopping Womens Fashion Menswear Streetwear Shoes Kids Health & Wellbeing Yoga studios Pilates Studios Nail Bars Hair Salons Gyms Arts & Culture Galleries & Museums Music Public Art Activities Entertainment Activities Getting Active Free Things To Do Parking & Transport Buses Ferries Trains Parking Precincts Britomart Aotea Arts Quarter Federal & Elliott Street Fort Street Area Queen Street Viaduct & Waterfront Wynyard Quarter City Works Depot High Street District Victoria Park Neighbourhoods Commercial Bay Albert Street Area Elliott Street Federal Street Lorne Street Silo Park & North Wharf The Viaduct Chancery Square Vulcan Lane Visit New In The City The Transforming City City Centre Map Hotels Special Offers Activities Attractions Bars and nightlife Dining Health and wellbeing Shopping Visit the New Zealand Maritime Museum Previous Next New Zealand Maritime Museum Celebrating the explorative spirit of a seafaring nation Add to favourites The Viaduct, Quay Street, +64 9 373 0800 Opening hours Currently closed Monday: 10:00 am-4:00 pm Tuesday: 10:00 am-4:00 pm Wednesday: 10:00 am-4:00 pm Thursday: 10:00 am-4:00 pm Friday: 10:00 am-4:00 pm Saturday: 10:00 am-4:00 pm Sunday: 10:00 am-4:00 pm Website Facebook Email Show on map Attractions Auckland Tourist Attractions The New Zealand Maritime Museum is the place where Aotearoa’s stories of people and the sea are preserved, shared and celebrated. Every one of us is affected by te moana/the ocean, whether through immigration, trade, leisure or harvesting of kaimoana/seafood. The museum is a hub for these stories; you’ll experience them in permanent galleries and through a diverse range of events, exhibitions, harbour sailings and more Interactive and immersive, this museum is a great place for all ages. Try your hand at virtual yacht-racing, marvel at traditional Polynesian vaka/outrigger design, hoist the sails, hear the cannon fire, test your sea legs and batten down the hatches in the rocking cabin. Join their crew for a sailing aboard the beautifully maintained heritage scow Ted Ashby. Enjoy the feeling of the wind in your hair, the sound of the waves and the smell of the salt air. Take in the city skyline including the iconic Auckland Harbour Bridge as you cruise the sparkling water of the Waitemata. For more information, and booking details for the Ted Ashby sailings - click here . Bookings recommended, additional cost for sailing. Te Ao Pūtahi Festival Te Manaaki, Auckland's Giant Christmas Tree Main menu (Mega) Events Today Tomorrow This Week This Weekend What's On This Month Food & Drink Events Festivals Theatre Exhibitions Music Events Dining Breakfast Lunch Dinner Dessert Cafés Cheap Eats Chinese Korean Japanese Vegan & Vegetarian Bars & Nightlife Bars Open Air Bars Happy Hour Pubs Clubs Live Music Shopping Womens Fashion Menswear Streetwear Shoes Kids Health & Wellbeing Yoga studios Pilates Studios Nail Bars Hair Salons Gyms Arts & Culture Galleries & Museums Music Public Art Activities Entertainment Activities Getting Active Free Things To Do Parking & Transport Buses Ferries Trains Parking Precincts Britomart Aotea Arts Quarter Federal & Elliott Street Fort Street Area Queen Street Viaduct & Waterfront Wynyard Quarter City Works Depot High Street District Victoria Park Neighbourhoods Commercial Bay Albert Street Area Elliott Street Federal Street Lorne Street Silo Park & North Wharf The Viaduct Chancery Square Vulcan Lane Visit New In The City The Transforming City City Centre Map Hotels Special Offers Activities Attractions Bars and nightlife Dining Health and wellbeing Shopping Image Auckland Live Previous Next The Civic One of the few remaining atmospheric theatres in the world Add to favourites Corner Queen & Wellesley Street West, 0800 111 999 Website Facebook Email Show on map Attractions The Civic, one of the few remaining atmospheric theatres in the world, was built in 1929 and specifically designed as a 'movie palace' for talking pictures ('talkies'), which had just been introduced to New Zealand. The first purpose-built cinema of this type in the country, The Civic has become a much-loved Auckland landmark and entertainment venue, with everything from world-class musicals, to well-known pop stars and the NZ International Film Festival all using this magnificent venue. Go behind the scenes of Auckland's most iconic theatre Step behind the scenes and discover the secrets of Auckland's most iconic theatre, The Civic on a journey that spans almost one hundred years. Find out more, and book your tour, here. Add to favourites Cnr Federal & Victoria Streets, 0800 462 8649 Opening hours Currently closed Monday: 10:00 am-5:00 pm Tuesday: 10:00 am-5:00 pm Wednesday: 10:00 am-5:00 pm Thursday: 10:00 am-5:00 pm Friday: 10:00 am-5:00 pm Saturday: 10:00 am-5:00 pm Sunday: 10:00 am-5:00 pm Website Email Show on map Attractions Auckland Tourist Attractions SkyJump is one of New Zealand's most thrilling tourist attractions and one of Auckland’s 'don’t miss' experiences. SkyJump can be described as Base Jumping, while attached to a wire – just like a movie stuntman! You’ll fall very fast (approximately 85kph) for around 11 seconds, and then come to a very smooth landing in the Sky City plaza below. SkyJump is the perfect Auckland activity for young and old and is the ideal corporate team building activity for businesses in Auckland! $2.50 per hour to a max of $12.50 on weekends and a $12.50 flat rate for weekday evenings at The Civic car park. Find out more . Te Ao Pūtahi Festival Te Manaaki, Auckland's Giant Christmas Tree Main menu (Mega) Events Today Tomorrow This Week This Weekend What's On This Month Food & Drink Events Festivals Theatre Exhibitions Music Events Dining Breakfast Lunch Dinner Dessert Cafés Cheap Eats Chinese Korean Japanese Vegan & Vegetarian Bars & Nightlife Bars Open Air Bars Happy Hour Pubs Clubs Live Music Shopping Womens Fashion Menswear Streetwear Shoes Kids Health & Wellbeing Yoga studios Pilates Studios Nail Bars Hair Salons Gyms Arts & Culture Galleries & Museums Music Public Art Activities Entertainment Activities Getting Active Free Things To Do Parking & Transport Buses Ferries Trains Parking Precincts Britomart Aotea Arts Quarter Federal & Elliott Street Fort Street Area Queen Street Viaduct & Waterfront Wynyard Quarter City Works Depot High Street District Victoria Park Neighbourhoods Commercial Bay Albert Street Area Elliott Street Federal Street Lorne Street Silo Park & North Wharf The Viaduct Chancery Square Vulcan Lane Visit New In The City The Transforming City City Centre Map Hotels Special Offers Activities Attractions Bars and nightlife Dining Health and wellbeing Shopping All Blacks Experience Te Wairua Ōpango Add to favourites SkyCity , 88 Federal Street Opening hours Currently closed Monday: 9:30 am-6:00 pm Tuesday: 9:30 am-6:00 pm Wednesday: 9:30 am-6:00 pm Thursday: 9:30 am-6:00 pm Friday: 9:30 am-6:00 pm Saturday: 9:30 am-6:00 pm Sunday: 9:30 am-6:00 pm Website Facebook Instagram Show on map Attractions Auckland Tourist Attractions Learn the story, feel the passion and experience the All Blacks story close and personal. The All Blacks Experience is a state-of-the-art guided encounter that showcases the All Blacks, Black Ferns, and our other national rugby teams in black through exceptional innovation and technology. This full sensory and interactive experience allows New Zealanders and international manuhiri (visitors) to celebrate New Zealand's rugby heritage, achievements, and culture. Understand and appreciate why the haka plays an integral role in physically and mentally preparing All Black teams for battle. You can then test your own rugby skills against All Blacks and Black Ferns in our hands-on, interactive zone. The 45-minute experience immerses manuhiri in the history, culture and people who have made the All Blacks such an important part of New Zealand’s story. Learn how the game became so closely tied to our national identity. Follow the journey a player makes from club rugby to the legendary All Blacks. Experience first-hand the excitement and emotion of game day. Discover the stories behind some of world rugby’s most famous player, moments and matches. Test your kicking, catching, line out and accuracy skills against the All Blacks. Through the use of innovation and technology, the experience will provide a full sensory, interactive, and immersive experience; the only rugby attraction of its kind in New Zealand and the only All Blacks attraction in the world. Make it truly yours with a personalised All Blacks jersey The All Blacks Experience is also home to the largest All Blacks retail store in the country and the only official store where visitors can purchase personalised jerseys , this new attraction is a must for rugby fans. The All Blacks Experience are the winners in the Digital-Interactives and Exhibition section of the Design Awards! The intelligent and inspirational vision behind All Blacks Experience has been recognised as the best of the best. Ngāi Tahu Tourism and New Zealand Rugby’s SkyCity-based attraction along with its creative partners Satellite Media, WORKSHOP E and EQ Made have been named as winners in the Digital – Interactives and Exhibition section of the Best Design Awards. The highly respected awards have been running since the 1970s and are an annual showcase of excellence in graphic, spatial, product, digital and motion design. The judges applauded All Blacks Experience’s integrated story-telling as a smart way to engage all generations and bring the family together in a fun and memorable way. $2.50 per hour to a max of $12.50 on weekends and a $12.50 flat rate for weekday evenings at The Civic car park. Find out more . The All Blacks Experience is a state-of-the-art guided encounter that showcases the All Blacks, Black Ferns, and our other national rugby teams in black through exceptional innovation and technology. This full sensory and interactive experience allows New Zealanders and international manuhiri (visitors) to celebrate New Zealand's rugby heritage, achievements, and culture. Understand and appreciate why the haka plays an integral role in physically and mentally preparing All Black teams for battle. You can then test your own rugby skills against All Blacks and Black Ferns in our hands-on, interactive zone. The 45-minute experience immerses manuhiri in the history, culture and people who have made the All Blacks such an important part of New Zealand’s story. Learn how the game became so closely tied to our national identity. Follow the journey a player makes from club rugby to the legendary All Blacks. Experience first-hand the excitement and emotion of game day. Discover the stories behind some of world rugby’s most famous player, moments and matches. Test your kicking, catching, line out and accuracy skills against the All Blacks. Through the use of innovation and technology, the experience will provide a full sensory, interactive, and immersive experience; the only rugby attraction of its kind in New Zealand and the only All Blacks attraction in the world. Make it truly yours with a personalised All Blacks jersey The All Blacks Experience is also home to the largest All Blacks retail store in the country and the only official store where visitors can purchase personalised jerseys , this new attraction is a must for rugby fans. The All Blacks Experience are the winners in the Digital-Interactives and Exhibition section of the Design Awards! The intelligent and inspirational vision behind All Blacks Experience has been recognised as the best of the best. Ngāi Tahu Tourism and New Zealand Rugby’s SkyCity-based attraction along with its creative partners Satellite Media, WORKSHOP E and EQ Made have been named as winners in the Digital – Interactives and Exhibition section of the Best Design Awards. The highly respected awards have been running since the 1970s and are an annual showcase of excellence in graphic, spatial, product, digital and motion design. The judges applauded All Blacks Experience’s integrated story-telling as a smart way to engage all generations and bring the family together in a fun and memorable way. $2.50 per hour to a max of $12.50 on weekends and a $12.50 flat rate for weekday evenings at The Civic car park. Find out more . description: Discover Captain Bar's Appleton Estate "Te Mahere" — a vibrant Kiwi-inspired cocktail crafted with Appleton Estate 8yr, pistachio orgeat, manuka honey infused with horopito, and lime. It’s a bold fusion of native botanicals and nutty depth, delivering an earthy, multi-layered experience. © 2012 - 2025 Heart of the City. All rights reserved.

Match your drink with tapas and sharing platters designed by Argentinian Chef de Cuisine Leo Minelli. The menu includes Escabeche Tostada, Kikoranga Empanadas, and Carne Asada & Chimichurri. There are approx. 60 rums to choose from, helpfully categorised as fruity, floral, oaky or spiced, with something sure to please even the most discerning palate. While the majority hail from the Caribbean and South America, the list also includes Bayou XO Mardi Gras Edition from Louisiana as well as New Zealand rum Helmsman Spiced. The Captain’s Bar is a cosy den, where guests can settle into plush chairs and relax beside the roaring fire. It’s the perfect place to enjoy a cocktail experience. Classic cocktails are available on request, as well as house specials Café Corretto, Southern Slipper and White Cloud, to name but a few. Leo Minelli is from Mendoza in Argentina and was raised on his family’s farm, which prompted a love of fresh produce and flavours, sparking a desire to cook more. He studied at Islas Malvinas University before undertaking a series of Chef positions in South America, including Brazil and Uruquay as well as The Bahamas. Captain's Bar Previous Next Spotlight on ... It’s a bold fusion of native botanicals and nutty depth, delivering an earthy, multi-layered experience. Free parking for your first hour at Jellicoe Street car park. See more here . Te Ao Pūtahi Festival Te Manaaki, Auckland's Giant Christmas Tree Main menu (Mega) Events Today Tomorrow This Week This Weekend What's On This Month Food & Drink Events Festivals Theatre Exhibitions Music Events Dining Breakfast Lunch Dinner Dessert Cafés Cheap Eats Chinese Korean Japanese Vegan & Vegetarian Bars & Nightlife Bars Open Air Bars Happy Hour Pubs Clubs Live Music Shopping Womens Fashion Menswear Streetwear Shoes Kids Health & Wellbeing Yoga studios Pilates Studios Nail Bars Hair Salons Gyms Arts & Culture Galleries & Museums Music Public Art Activities Entertainment Activities Getting Active Free Things To Do Parking & Transport Buses Ferries Trains Parking Precincts Britomart Aotea Arts Quarter Federal & Elliott Street Fort Street Area Queen Street Viaduct & Waterfront Wynyard Quarter City Works Depot High Street District Victoria Park Neighbourhoods Commercial Bay Albert Street Area Elliott Street Federal Street Lorne Street Silo Park & North Wharf The Viaduct Chancery Square Vulcan Lane Visit New In The City The Transforming City City Centre Map Hotels Special Offers Activities Attractions Bars and nightlife Dining Health and wellbeing Shopping Previous Next Captain’s Bar Park Hyatt Auckland Add to favourites 99 Halsey Street, Opening hours Currently closed Monday: 4:00 pm-Late Tuesday: 4:00 pm-Late Wednesday: 4:00 pm-Late Thursday: 4:00 pm-Late Friday: 4:00 pm-Late Saturday: 4:00 pm-Late Sunday: 4:00 pm-Late Website Show on map Bars and Nightlife Bars Sit by the fireplace or on the outdoor terrace and enjoy the stunning views as you sample a fine selection of rums or classic cocktails with a local twist. Match your drink with tapas and sharing platters designed by Argentinian Chef de Cuisine Leo Minelli. The menu includes Escabeche Tostada, Kikoranga Empanadas, and Carne Asada & Chimichurri. There are approx. 60 rums to choose from, helpfully categorised as fruity, floral, oaky or spiced, with something sure to please even the most discerning palate. While the majority hail from the Caribbean and South America, the list also includes Bayou XO Mardi Gras Edition from Louisiana as well as New Zealand rum Helmsman Spiced. The Captain’s Bar is a cosy den, where guests can settle into plush chairs and relax beside the roaring fire. It’s the perfect place to enjoy a cocktail experience. Classic cocktails are available on request, as well as house specials Café Corretto, Southern Slipper and White Cloud, to name but a few. Leo Minelli is from Mendoza in Argentina and was raised on his family’s farm, which prompted a love of fresh produce and flavours, sparking a desire to cook more. He studied at Islas Malvinas University before undertaking a series of Chef positions in South America, including Brazil and Uruquay as well as The Bahamas. Captain's Bar Previous Next Spotlight on ... It’s a bold fusion of native botanicals and nutty depth, delivering an earthy, multi-layered experience. Free parking for your first hour at Jellicoe Street car park. See more here . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Te Ao Pūtahi Festival Te Manaaki, Auckland's Giant Christmas Tree Main menu (Mega) Events Today Tomorrow This Week This Weekend What's On This Month Food & Drink Events Festivals Theatre Exhibitions Music Events Dining Breakfast Lunch Dinner Dessert Cafés Cheap Eats Chinese Korean Japanese Vegan & Vegetarian Bars & Nightlife Bars Open Air Bars Happy Hour Pubs Clubs Live Music Shopping Womens Fashion Menswear Streetwear Shoes Kids Health & Wellbeing Yoga studios Pilates Studios Nail Bars Hair Salons Gyms Arts & Culture Galleries & Museums Music Public Art Activities Entertainment Activities Getting Active Free Things To Do Parking & Transport Buses Ferries Trains Parking Precincts Britomart Aotea Arts Quarter Federal & Elliott Street Fort Street Area Queen Street Viaduct & Waterfront Wynyard Quarter City Works Depot High Street District Victoria Park Neighbourhoods Commercial Bay Albert Street Area Elliott Street Federal Street Lorne Street Silo Park & North Wharf The Viaduct Chancery Square Vulcan Lane Visit New In The City The Transforming City City Centre Map Hotels Special Offers Activities Attractions Bars and nightlife Dining Health and wellbeing Shopping Image Supplied Image Supplied Image sourced from Rocketman Previous Next Rocketman an 80-seat retrofuturism-themed bar on Customs Street Add to favourites 40 Customs St E, Opening hours Currently closed Monday: Closed Tuesday: Closed Wednesday: 5:00 pm-2:00 am Thursday: 5:00 pm-2:00 am Friday: 5:00 pm-2:00 am Saturday: 5:00 pm-2:00 am Sunday: Closed Instagram Website Show on map Bars and Nightlife Bars The team behind Caretaker & Deadshot has unveiled their latest creation - Rocketman , a whimsical party bar that refuses to take life too seriously. Rocketman , an homage to retro-futurism, welcomes you to a departure lounge where escapism knows no bounds. A touch of madness and a hint of mischief await within, and they've stored away a few surprises to ensure that your visit is nothing short of a blast. Among the most enchanting moments bartenders at Rocketman have experienced is when the entire bar unites in joyous song. They've based the entire concept of this bar on that electrifying feeling. You can anticipate a playlist filled with beloved 90s hip hop classics and a sprinkle of disco vibes. Live bands will also grace the stage, serenading you with jazz-hip-hop fusion. Rocketman offers a versatile space, ideal for hosting events that cater to a guest list of 20 to 100 people. Whether it's whisky tastings or cocktail masterclasses, this bar has got you covered. And for those seeking a bit of privacy, there's Ms Kitty's Parlour, a hidden karaoke haven. So, as they say, they'll bring the party; all you need to bring is your delightful self. You'll find ROCKETMAN conveniently located above Caretaker on Custom St East. Operating from Wednesday to Saturday, the fun starts at 5 pm and continues until 2 am. If you're lucky, it might even stretch to 3 am. Images sourced from Rocketman . Spotlight on ... Saturday Night Jazz Rocketman Head to Rocketman for live jazz-hip-hop beats every Saturday night from 9–11pm featuring Junglebird. Park for $2.50 per hour at the Downtown car park to a maximum of $15.50 on evenings and weekends. Find out more . Found in Snickel Lane, this unique bar is your gateway to relaxed and vibrant island vibes - right in the heart of the city. Head to Snickel Lane for a taste of Waiheke every Thursday-Saturday, from 3pm-9.30pm and immerse yourself in a botanical oasis while enjoying some of Waiheke’s finest beverages! They'll be serving up Tantalus Estate wines, Alibi craft beers, artisan G&T’s, botanical vodkas, cocktails, platters and more. Products may also be purchased to enjoy at home. Park for $2.50 per hour at the Victoria St car park on evenings and weekends. Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Found in Snickel Lane, this unique bar is your gateway to relaxed and vibrant island vibes - right in the heart of the city. Head to Snickel Lane for a taste of Waiheke every Thursday-Saturday, from 3pm-9.30pm and immerse yourself in a botanical oasis while enjoying some of Waiheke’s finest beverages! They'll be serving up Tantalus Estate wines, Alibi craft beers, artisan G&T’s, botanical vodkas, cocktails, platters and more. Products may also be purchased to enjoy at home. Park for $2.50 per hour at the Victoria St car park on evenings and weekends. Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Bars and Nightlife Bars Fort Street Area Last updated: 19 February 2025 Add to favourites In the neighbourhood Fort Street Area City Jungle City Jungle is an oasis in the city with a great selection of indoor plants and all your plant care needs. Add to favourites Fort Street Area Eyelight Lane This installation has been described as a "meandering red neon line mounted on buildings on either side of Fort Lane that... Add to favourites Federal & Elliott Cassia at SkyCity Serving up Indian cuisine with a modern twist, Cassia is an award-winning restaurant from famed chef Sid Sahrawat. Add to favourites Fort Street Area Snickel Lane This inner city laneway should be your next destination for quality socialising, eating and drinking. Live music, international DJs, plus a full lunch and dinner menu, Parked Up is destined to become your new local. Currently open for private functions. Opening on September 20th, 2024 for casual walk-ins. Parked Up Beer Garden & Venue is fully equipped with all the trimmings to get your event into the swing – sound system to thump out the tunes, food and beverage to suit all occasions, rooms to suit the size of your event and a location second to none in Victoria Park. Our festoon and fairy lighting takes effect when the sun goes down and the party heats up. Enjoy petanque, giant jenga and other fun lawn games outside in the garden. Upcoming Events at Parked Up Beer Garden & Venue 1 result 30 NOV 2025 | 4.30PM-9PM ARTT-CITO Celebrate Culture & creativity at ARTT-CITO, a blend of Latin American art, NZ tea culture, music & pizza. Add to favourites $7.50 flat parking rate on weekends at the Fanshawe St car park. Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Parked Up Beer Garden & Venue is fully equipped with all the trimmings to get your event into the swing – sound system to thump out the tunes, food and beverage to suit all occasions, rooms to suit the size of your event and a location second to none in Victoria Park. Our festoon and fairy lighting takes effect when the sun goes down and the party heats up. Enjoy petanque, giant jenga and other fun lawn games outside in the garden. Upcoming Events at Parked Up Beer Garden & Venue 1 result 30 NOV 2025 | 4.30PM-9PM ARTT-CITO Celebrate Culture & creativity at ARTT-CITO, a blend of Latin American art, NZ tea culture, music & pizza. Add to favourites $7.50 flat parking rate on weekends at the Fanshawe St car park. Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Palmer is your urban oasis, a unique bar and dining experience in a space designed to inspire. Sit back and relax as you enjoy your favourite drink and dish or join friends on the terrace by the fire pit for shared plates and bubbles. The choice is yours; the taste and setting are exclusive to Palmer. Palmer's food menu features gnocco fritto - savoury Italian doughnuts with Poaka Farms cured pork served with gentleman's relish & pecorino, chicken-liver parfait with fermented beetroot and wood-fired bread from the kitchen's open-fire barbecue, and wood-fired leeks with raisin, hazelnuts and smoked tofu cream. There's also a tasty selection of sweets, including a Mille Feuille of apples with diplomat cream and apple syrup. The cocktail menu is also just as impressive with delightful creations such as the Manuka Martini with Roots Malborough gin, dry vermouth and manuka liqueur, or the Kiwi Coffee with brown butter Thompson Manuka whisky, coffee liqueur, cold brew and gingernut cream. For 15 years they have been delivering a diverse mosaic of programming, bringing Auckland’s best parties to life and giving each unique scene and community they collaborate with a home. They're honoured to do what they do and invite you to join them in the fun! Hosting an array of local acts, touring internationals, first timers and party veterans there is little you will be unable to find in our event calendar. From live music to DJs, drag to comedy, art exhibitions to slam poetry, all brought to you, our whanau, by the whanau; a quirky, sassy bunch of mischievous misfits and allround astounding humans that we are forever grateful to for all the love, energy and passion they put in to what they do. It is their aim to create events that uncover the edge, bringing you fresh and exciting music and art that will get your mind ticking and your body bobbing. They want to leave beautiful lasting memories in your mind, host parties that make an impact on your life, and create a space that they can pride themselves on as being SAFE(R). Cassette9 is much more than a bar or a nightclub, Cassette9 is a home, a home to you no matter who you are - so welcome! For private functions and for all entertainment related bookings, email [email protected] Previous Next Park for $2.50 per hour, to a maximum of $10.50 on evenings and weekends at the Victoria St car park. Find out more . description: Make the littlies' first cinema experience a special one with Event's Little Kids Screenings. Enjoy family films in a child-friendly setting, perfect for their very first trip to the cinema (and beyond!). This big screen experience has been designed specifically for kids under 5 with fewer ads & trailers as well as dimmed lights and volume. Plus, enjoy exclusive Candy Bar deals. for Ts&Cs Experience retro classics on the big screen exclusively at EVENT Queen Street and Embassy Theatre! for more information. © 2012 - 2025 Heart of the City. Indulge in a little Gold Class comfort or watch your favourite movie in the IMAX Cinema (the largest screen in New Zealand). Located in the Metro Building right on Queen Street, this convenient location is easy to get to and in a great spot for pre or post movie meals. Special offers at Event Cinemas Student Mondays MONDAYS All day Monday, enjoy half price student tickets across every movie experience – Original, Gold Class, Boutique, V-Max, and IMAX. Click here for Ts&Cs. Cinebuzz Half Price Tuesdays TUESDAYS Nothing beats a trip to the movies! All day Tuesday, enjoy half price adult tickets across every movie experience – Gold Class, Boutique, V-Max, IMAX and Original. Click here for Ts&Cs. IMAX Half Price Tuesdays TUESDAYS Experience movies like never before with IMAX with Laser — exclusively at EVENT Cinemas Queen St and Queensgate. Grab your half-price tickets every Tuesday and make it a night to remember! Book here . Spotlight on ... Little Kids Screenings Event Cinemas Make the littlies' first cinema experience a special one with Event's Little Kids Screenings. Enjoy family films in a child-friendly setting, perfect for their very first trip to the cinema (and beyond!). This big screen experience has been designed specifically for kids under 5 with fewer ads & trailers as well as dimmed lights and volume. Plus, enjoy exclusive Candy Bar deals. Click here for Ts&Cs The Retro Classic Series Event Cinemas Experience retro classics on the big screen exclusively at EVENT Queen Street and Embassy Theatre! Click here for more information. Get $2.50 parking per hour to a maximum of $15.50 on evenings and weekends at the Downtown car park . Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . So whether you're a tourist visiting Auckland, or a local, there's plenty happening for you at the Empire Tavern: Live Music Large Screens for live sports Garden Bar in the heart of the city - lots of greenery, with a canopy to keep the showers away and gas heaters Big Tuesday Quiz night, starts at 6.30pm Bookings recommended. $7.50 flat parking rate on weekends at the Fanshawe St car park. This Victorian‑style Irish pub boasts an impressive collection of 160+ Irish whiskeys, the Bloom Terrace rooftop bar, massive live sport screens, and private event spaces designed for every occasion. Whether it’s a corporate function, birthday bash, conference dinner, or casual welcome drinks, Slattery & Sons delivers elevated hospitality with flexible spaces to suit. Enjoy sweeping city views from the rooftop, unwind in a dedicated whiskey parlour, and experience Britomart’s largest outdoor area—all just moments from top hotels, cruise terminals, and the city’s best attractions. Park for $2.50 per hour at the Downtown car park to a maximum of $15.50 on evenings and weekends. Find out more . Monday: 9:00 am-6:00 pm Tuesday: 9:00 am-8:00 pm Wednesday: 9:00 am-8:00 pm Thursday: 9:00 am-8:00 pm Friday: 9:00 am-8:00 pm Saturday: 10:00 am-5:00 pm Sunday: 10:00 am-5:00 pm Website Facebook Show on map Attractions Auckland Tourist Attractions The Auckland Central City Library has a strong community focus, offering many opportunities to join in events and activities. These include author talks, book clubs, kids' storytimes, school holiday programmes, concerts and heritage exhibitions. You will find extensive collections of fiction, non-fiction, magazines, music, and much more to satisfy all your requests. Members and visitors benefit from the free access to computersand WiFi, and comfortable seating areas for your research, study or leisure reading. Monday: 7:00 am-11:00 pm Tuesday: 7:00 am-11:00 pm Wednesday: 7:00 am-11:00 pm Thursday: 7:00 am-11:00 pm Friday: 7:00 am-Late Saturday: 11:00 am-Late Sunday: 11:00 am-11:00 pm Website Email Show on map Dining Takeaways Gourmet Burger & Brew Kitchen on Quay Street offers a menu of twenty-six unique burger combinations - all freshly made to order with local meat and vegetables. This is an ideal place to stop in for a quality takeaway meal, an uncomplicated and tasty lunch with friends, a satisfying beer and burger after work or a tasty meal with the kids during a day out in the city. The classics are all represented at Burger & Brew - and made to perfection or perhaps try something a little different from its unique and appetising menu. Monday: 7:00 am-11:00 pm Tuesday: 7:00 am-11:00 pm Wednesday: 7:00 am-11:00 pm Thursday: 7:00 am-11:00 pm Friday: 7:00 am-Late Saturday: 11:00 am-Late Sunday: 11:00 am-11:00 pm Website Email Show on map Dining Takeaways Gourmet Burger & Brew Kitchen on Quay Street offers a menu of twenty-six unique burger combinations - all freshly made to order with local meat and vegetables. This is an ideal place to stop in for a quality takeaway meal, an uncomplicated and tasty lunch with friends, a satisfying beer and burger after work or a tasty meal with the kids during a day out in the city. The classics are all represented at Burger & Brew - and made to perfection or perhaps try something a little different from its unique and appetising menu. Flat fee of $7.50 per day on weekends at Fanshawe Street carpark. Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . With decor i nspired by the one and only Frida Kahlo, one of Mexico's most famous and loved artists, when you step through the doors of Frida Cocina y ou’ll feel like you are in the middle of Coyoacan, Mexico City. Enjoy refined Mexican food in a unique style, unlike anything you’ve tried before. Special offers at Frida Cocina Mexicana & Tequila Bar Happy Hour at Frida Cocina DAILY | 5-7PM From 5pm-7pm every day Frida Cocina is offering a range of delicious, ice-cold margaritas, including their happy hour $10 frozen margarita, and $9 tap beer. Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Originally from the islands of the South Pacific, kava has recently become popular around the world. People across the globe value it for its rich cultural history and relaxing properties. Some drink it for relief from stress, anxiety or insomnia. Others consume it for purely recreational or social purposes. Kava is known for its ability to promote relaxation, sociability and a feeling of harmony without diminishing judgement, mental clarity or awareness. For many users, kava is a pleasant, slightly stimulating drink that relieves fatigue, relaxes the body after hard work or effort, clarifies the mind and brings a sense of well-being. As such, to many kava presents an attractive, non-addictive and healthier alternative to alcohol. When consumed with friends, kava can promote peace, tranquillity and cooperation. $7.50 flat parking rate on weekends at the Fanshawe St car park. Find out more . Te Ao Pūtahi Festival Te Manaaki, Auckland's Giant Christmas Tree Main menu (Mega) Events Today Tomorrow This Week This Weekend What's On This Month Food & Drink Events Festivals Theatre Exhibitions Music Events Dining Breakfast Lunch Dinner Dessert Cafés Cheap Eats Chinese Korean Japanese Vegan & Vegetarian Bars & Nightlife Bars Open Air Bars Happy Hour Pubs Clubs Live Music Shopping Womens Fashion Menswear Streetwear Shoes Kids Health & Wellbeing Yoga studios Pilates Studios Nail Bars Hair Salons Gyms Arts & Culture Galleries & Museums Music Public Art Activities Entertainment Activities Getting Active Free Things To Do Parking & Transport Buses Ferries Trains Parking Precincts Britomart Aotea Arts Quarter Federal & Elliott Street Fort Street Area Queen Street Viaduct & Waterfront Wynyard Quarter City Works Depot High Street District Victoria Park Neighbourhoods Commercial Bay Albert Street Area Elliott Street Federal Street Lorne Street Silo Park & North Wharf The Viaduct Chancery Square Vulcan Lane Visit New In The City The Transforming City City Centre Map Hotels Special Offers Activities Attractions Bars and nightlife Dining Health and wellbeing Shopping Image supplied Estelle's Bar Grand Millennium Auckland Add to favourites Grand Millenium Auckland, +6493663000 Opening hours Currently closed Monday: 5:00 pm-11:30 pm Tuesday: 5:00 pm-11:30 pm Wednesday: 5:00 pm-11:30 pm Thursday: 5:00 pm-11:30 pm Friday: 5:00 pm-11:30 pm Saturday: 5:00 pm-11:30 pm Sunday: 5:00 pm-11:30 pm Website Instagram Facebook Show on map Bars and Nightlife Bars Located in the heart of the city on level one of Grand Millennium Auckland, Estelle's a sultry wine and cocktail bar that will transport you to the sun-drenched shores of the Mediterranean. A sophisticated setting fashioned by acclaimed designer Paul Izzard , Estelle's envelops you in a warmth reminiscent of the glamour of a bygone age. The space features a carefully curated colour palette of rich mahogany, dramatic black, and sultry garnet red, creating an atmosphere that's both elegant and inviting. Estelle’s brings an element of performance with chefs and bar staff preparing dishes to order in full view. Service is intentionally swift, with food arriving fast to maintain the energy and spontaneity of authentic Spanish dining. Their signature cocktail program honours Spanish and Mediterranean concoctions with a contemporary twist. Highlights include the Estelle's Dirty Negroni , Hachi Flotar and Espresso Martini on tap. Estelle's also offers a thoughtfully crafted mocktail menu that rivals its alcoholic counterparts in complexity and flavour. Standout drinks include The Coconut Lychee Mojito , Caramel Apple Pie and The Summer to Autumn - all classy options for those choosing not to drink alcohol. Executive Chef James Kenny and Head Chef Aaron Hyett have designed seasonal, Spanish-influenced raciones to complement Estelle’s drinks menu and encourage sharing and conversation. You can indulge in a premium selection of Iberian jamón including Caña de lomo, de bellota, and chorizo served with guindillas peppers. Other menu highlights include classic Gilda skewers featuring prawns with charred pineapple and jamón or Pan con tomate with sourdough and Ortiz anchovies, and Asparagus topped with jamón, manchego, watercress, and a Spanish-style fried egg. To finish, savour traditional Spanish dessert and a selection of Spanish cheeses served with muscatel grapes and honeycomb - the perfect pairing for a final glass of wine. $2.50 per hour to a max of $12.50 on weekends and a $12.50 flat rate for weekday evenings at The Civic car park. Find out more . A sophisticated setting fashioned by acclaimed designer Paul Izzard , Estelle's envelops you in a warmth reminiscent of the glamour of a bygone age. The space features a carefully curated colour palette of rich mahogany, dramatic black, and sultry garnet red, creating an atmosphere that's both elegant and inviting. Estelle’s brings an element of performance with chefs and bar staff preparing dishes to order in full view. Service is intentionally swift, with food arriving fast to maintain the energy and spontaneity of authentic Spanish dining. Their signature cocktail program honours Spanish and Mediterranean concoctions with a contemporary twist. Highlights include the Estelle's Dirty Negroni , Hachi Flotar and Espresso Martini on tap. Estelle's also offers a thoughtfully crafted mocktail menu that rivals its alcoholic counterparts in complexity and flavour. Standout drinks include The Coconut Lychee Mojito , Caramel Apple Pie and The Summer to Autumn - all classy options for those choosing not to drink alcohol. Executive Chef James Kenny and Head Chef Aaron Hyett have designed seasonal, Spanish-influenced raciones to complement Estelle’s drinks menu and encourage sharing and conversation. You can indulge in a premium selection of Iberian jamón including Caña de lomo, de bellota, and chorizo served with guindillas peppers. Other menu highlights include classic Gilda skewers featuring prawns with charred pineapple and jamón or Pan con tomate with sourdough and Ortiz anchovies, and Asparagus topped with jamón, manchego, watercress, and a Spanish-style fried egg. To finish, savour traditional Spanish dessert and a selection of Spanish cheeses served with muscatel grapes and honeycomb - the perfect pairing for a final glass of wine. $2.50 per hour to a max of $12.50 on weekends and a $12.50 flat rate for weekday evenings at The Civic car park. Find out more . The precinct’s spacious, architecturally designed and refurbished sheds are home to the likes of lunch time staples Best Ugly Bagels, Chur Bae and Phin, plus standout Odettes Eatery. Along with dining and bar options there is also a health and beauty offering with The Facialist and Lash Noir located in the lower terrace. Those shopping for home decor will also be happy to find the well established Weekend Trader on site too. With a rich history over the last 50 years City Works Depot has been home to things as diverse as workshops, parking, fashion shows and parties and this history continues to grow with the area facelift and new tenancies. Check out everything in City Works Depot here . $8 evening parking and $10 weekend parking at City Works Depot car park (Tournament Parking). Find out more . For corporate groups, there are full-on cooking classes for teams or to get to know clients better, space for product launches or brain-storming sessions, or just somewhere for a great time out from the office. All classes are fun, informative, up-close and hands-on. Plus there are the special KidzKitchen classes on offer for the young ones in your life too. Public classes cover skill based learning in the three courses on offer - Complete Basic, Better than Basic and Masterclass. There are a range of one-off evening classes with specific cuisine styles such as Mexican, Italian, Spanish Tapas, Vietnamese, Indian. Artisan skills are taught in weekend classes such as Cheesemaking, Breadmaking, Cake Decorating, Chocolatier and Patisserie. Located in the historic GasWorks building next to Victoria Park, this is a groovy light-filled space with tonnes of character and easy access to transport options. $7.50 flat parking rate on weekends at the Fanshawe St car park. Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Te Ao Pūtahi Festival Te Manaaki, Auckland's Giant Christmas Tree Main menu (Mega) Events Today Tomorrow This Week This Weekend What's On This Month Food & Drink Events Festivals Theatre Exhibitions Music Events Dining Breakfast Lunch Dinner Dessert Cafés Cheap Eats Chinese Korean Japanese Vegan & Vegetarian Bars & Nightlife Bars Open Air Bars Happy Hour Pubs Clubs Live Music Shopping Womens Fashion Menswear Streetwear Shoes Kids Health & Wellbeing Yoga studios Pilates Studios Nail Bars Hair Salons Gyms Arts & Culture Galleries & Museums Music Public Art Activities Entertainment Activities Getting Active Free Things To Do Parking & Transport Buses Ferries Trains Parking Precincts Britomart Aotea Arts Quarter Federal & Elliott Street Fort Street Area Queen Street Viaduct & Waterfront Wynyard Quarter City Works Depot High Street District Victoria Park Neighbourhoods Commercial Bay Albert Street Area Elliott Street Federal Street Lorne Street Silo Park & North Wharf The Viaduct Chancery Square Vulcan Lane Visit New In The City The Transforming City City Centre Map Hotels Special Offers Activities Attractions Bars and nightlife Dining Health and wellbeing Shopping Previous Next Huami Bar Begin your night with a little elegance Add to favourites 87 Federal Street, 09 363 6699 Opening hours Currently closed Monday: Closed Tuesday: Closed Wednesday: 11:30 am-2:30 pm, 5:30 pm-9:30 pm Thursday: 11:30 am-2:30 pm, 5:30 pm-9:30 pm Friday: 11:30 am-2:30 pm, 5:30 pm-9:30 pm Saturday: 11:30 am-2:30 pm, 5:30 pm-9:30 pm Sunday: 11:30 am-2:30 pm, 5:30 pm-9:30 pm Website Show on map Bars and Nightlife Happy Hour Tucked behind a bamboo screen on Federal Street, Huami Bar offers a sanctuary in the heart of the bustling inner city precinct. Sister to SkyCity's Chinese restaurant Huami , it’s the ideal spot for a quiet drink or to start that big night ahead. Taking you back to 1920s Shanghai, perch up at the bar, cosy up in a booth out back or take in the view at a table in front, all while enjoying a specialty cocktail or two. The Huami Bar offers an exclusive range of armagnac, cognac and whisky as well as a specially developed cocktail list. Showcasing traditional Chinese flavours, the impressive cocktail list includes the Royal 75, an elegant combination of lychee, gin and orange topped with perrier-jouët champagne, the Sparkling Kiwi with chinese goosebery (kiwifruit) shaken up with lime and voka and the Shanghai Sour, frothy with white rum, pineapple, maraschino and spiced grenadine. The impressive whisky wall displays some of the finest cognac and armagnac in New Zealand while the extensive wine list was curated by New Zealand's only Master Sommelier, Cameron Douglas. Unique to Huami is its very own Chinese rice wine (baijiu), sourced directly from China - a must-try if you're looking for something authentic. Developed by Executive Chef Jeff Tan, Huami’s bold flavours and modern take on traditional Chinese cuisine can be enjoyed at the bar with the full à la carte menu available for lunch and dinner. Or for something lighter so as not to take the focus off your liquid refreshment, grab a bite to eat from the bar menu . $2.50 per hour to a max of $12.50 on weekends and a $12.50 flat rate for weekday evenings at The Civic car park. Find out more . Serving classic fare, delicious cocktails and a sprinkle of New Zealand history. Situated on Vulcan Lane, the Queen's Ferry is a cherished city centre landmark, with a rich history dating back to 1865. Originally established to cater to travelers and settlers, Queen's Ferry quickly became a hub of social activity and camaraderie, offering respite, refreshment for all. Over the years, it has stood witness to countless tables of adventure, laughter, and community bonding. The refreshed menu, which diverges from the typical old-English pub style, features dishes such as baked brie drizzled with hot honey and served with a toasted baguette, hot chicken sandwiches, calamari, liver pâté, and sticky toffee pudding with butterscotch sauce, to name a few! Equally as impressive is their cocktail menu, inspired by New Zealand history - featuring the likes of the '1865 The Beginning' cocktail, made with gin, honey, lemon and thyme, or the '2024 The Queen's Ferry x Moët & Chandon' cocktail with champagne, berries, peach and rosemary. Previous Next Park for $2.50 per hour, to a maximum of $10.50 on evenings and weekends at the Victoria St car park. Find out more . Quietly nestled amongst the hustle and bustle of shoppers on Vulcan Lane, Vulture's Lane is the perfect place to enjoy an after work drink. The craft beer selection is terrific with 22 regular rotating taps and over 75 bottles in the fridge to keep everyone happy and tasty eats on offer, it's menu is hard to beat after a long day at work. Quietly nestled amongst the hustle and bustle of shoppers on Vulcan Lane, Vulture's Lane is the perfect place to enjoy an after work drink. The craft beer selection is terrific with 22 regular rotating taps and over 75 bottles in the fridge to keep everyone happy and tasty eats on offer, it's menu is hard to beat after a long day at work. Park for $2.50 per hour, to a maximum of $10.50 on evenings and weekends at the Victoria St car park. Find out more . Monday: 9:00 am-Late Tuesday: 9:00 am-Late Wednesday: 9:00 am-Late Thursday: 9:00 am-Late Friday: 9:00 am-Late Saturday: 9:00 am-Late Sunday: 9:00 am-Late Website Facebook Email Show on map Bars and Nightlife Happy Hour Live music on Fridays & Saturdays! The Occidental's got live music every Friday and Saturday night from 9pm to midnight . Get your dancing shoes and head on down. Different acts every weekend! Click here for more information. Sunday roast and live music every Sunday! There's nothing better than curling up on a Sunday afternoon from 2-5pm at The Occidental with a pint of the best Belgian beer, a few bar snacks and a great easy listening band to wind down the weekend. Click here for more information. The Occidental Belgian Beer Cafe offers traditional Belgian fare at its very best, conveniently located on Vulcan Lane. This bar offers the full experience, with an array of Belgian beers on offer to complement the authentic cuisine on the menu. Whether you feel like a big pot of steaming mussels, or a cone of arguably the best fires in town, The Occidental has something for everyone. Escape your desk at lunchtime and head there for lunch or plan it in after work for some drinks with friends. Get your dancing shoes on and head to The Occidental on a Friday or Saturday night from 10pm-midnight for live music. Or, on a Sunday afternoon enjoy the best of Belgian beer, a few bar snacks and a great easy listening band to wind down the weekend. Special offers at The Occidental Belgian Beer Cafe Prime Angus Rump Tuesdays TUESDAYS Satisfy your Angus Rump craving at The Occidental every Tuesday ! The best part? It comes with a side of frites! Enjoy a 250g of steak for $20 or a 500g for $25 - all cooked to perfection. Click here for more information. Mussel Mania Mondays MONDAYS Grab a half pot of mussels for $15 or a one-kilo pot for $20 . For something bold, try the grilled mixed platter with all the flavours for just $18 — available all-day Monday . Click here for more information. Chicken Schnitzel Wednesdays WEDNESDAYS The Occidental's delicious chicken schnitzel served with slaw and frites is just $20 every Wednesday . Head in and get your fill! Click here for more information. Happy Hour Thursdays THURSDAYS | 4-6PM It's Happy Hour every Thursday evening! Join The Occidental for great specials on tap beer and house wine, 4pm-6pm . Upcoming Events at The Occidental Belgian Beer Cafe 1 result Every Friday & Saturday from 10PM- LATE & Sundays 2PM-5PM Live Music at the Occidental Looking for weekend plans? The Occidental's live music lineup has got you sorted. With live music from 9 til late on Fridays... Monday: 9:00 am-Late Tuesday: 9:00 am-Late Wednesday: 9:00 am-Late Thursday: 9:00 am-Late Friday: 9:00 am-Late Saturday: 9:00 am-Late Sunday: 9:00 am-Late Website Facebook Email Show on map Bars and Nightlife Happy Hour Live music on Fridays & Saturdays! The Occidental's got live music every Friday and Saturday night from 9pm to midnight . Get your dancing shoes and head on down. Different acts every weekend! Click here for more information. Sunday roast and live music every Sunday! There's nothing better than curling up on a Sunday afternoon from 2-5pm at The Occidental with a pint of the best Belgian beer, a few bar snacks and a great easy listening band to wind down the weekend. Click here for more information. The Occidental Belgian Beer Cafe offers traditional Belgian fare at its very best, conveniently located on Vulcan Lane. This bar offers the full experience, with an array of Belgian beers on offer to complement the authentic cuisine on the menu. Whether you feel like a big pot of steaming mussels, or a cone of arguably the best fires in town, The Occidental has something for everyone. Escape your desk at lunchtime and head there for lunch or plan it in after work for some drinks with friends. Get your dancing shoes on and head to The Occidental on a Friday or Saturday night from 10pm-midnight for live music. Or, on a Sunday afternoon enjoy the best of Belgian beer, a few bar snacks and a great easy listening band to wind down the weekend. Special offers at The Occidental Belgian Beer Cafe Prime Angus Rump Tuesdays TUESDAYS Satisfy your Angus Rump craving at The Occidental every Tuesday ! The best part? It comes with a side of frites! Enjoy a 250g of steak for $20 or a 500g for $25 - all cooked to perfection. Click here for more information. Mussel Mania Mondays MONDAYS Grab a half pot of mussels for $15 or a one-kilo pot for $20 . For something bold, try the grilled mixed platter with all the flavours for just $18 — available all-day Monday . Click here for more information. Chicken Schnitzel Wednesdays WEDNESDAYS The Occidental's delicious chicken schnitzel served with slaw and frites is just $20 every Wednesday . Head in and get your fill! Click here for more information. Happy Hour Thursdays THURSDAYS | 4-6PM It's Happy Hour every Thursday evening! Join The Occidental for great specials on tap beer and house wine, 4pm-6pm . Upcoming Events at The Occidental Belgian Beer Cafe 1 result Every Friday & Saturday from 10PM- LATE & Sundays 2PM-5PM Live Music at the Occidental Looking for weekend plans? The Occidental's live music lineup has got you sorted. With live music from 9 til late on Fridays... Add to favourites Park for $2.50 per hour, to a maximum of $10.50 on evenings and weekends at the Victoria St car park. Find out more . Add to favourites Doves and Globes Enjoy the gorgeous and much loved dove and globe installations and check out the globes change colours throughout the day... Add to favourites High Street District The Queen's Ferry Nestled in Vulcan Lane, Queen's Ferry is Auckland's oldest pub, serving classic fare and delicious cocktails. Add to favourites High Street District Curries And Kebab Delicious and budget friendly takeaway options perfect for a quick grab and go! Located in Auckland’s Viaduct, these small classes have an emphasis on hands-on practical experience that will expand your culinary repertoire in no time at all. With a choice of evening or weekend sessions for most of these short courses, they're the perfect way to upskill while balancing a busy lifestyle. NZ School of Food and Wine is open Monday to Friday and open for evening and weekend courses when scheduled. Flat fee of $7.50 per day on weekends at Fanshawe Street carpark. Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Their brands are recognised international market leaders for their exceptional quality and design, which means that Dive HQ Westhaven can advise you on the best selection of dive gear to suit your needs. Learn to dive They offer a range of PADI Recreational Courses from their stores in Auckland. Take a look at each of the courses available, including Open Water, Rescue Diver and Specialty Courses, and find out when you can dive in. Private lessons are also available. Enjoy two hours of free parking or $5 evening and weekend rates. Find out more . Ride on public transport from as little as $2 each way. Find out more . But sharing it with others comes pretty close. Fullers360 has been the leading ferry operator in Auckland for more than 35 years, connecting locals and visitors to the most sought-after coastal and island destinations. Fullers360 offers a range of ferry trips, tours and charters around Auckland Harbour and islands further afield. Explore the historic seaside suburb of Devonport, hike the volcanic Rangitoto Island, or for an eco-adventure, sail to the wildlife sanctuaries of Tiritiri Matangi Island and Rotoroa Island. Discover Waiheke Island by connecting straight from the ferry to your choice of Fullers360 sightseeing, wine and culinary tours. Flat fee of $7.50 per day on weekends at Fanshawe Street carpark. Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Te Ao Pūtahi Festival Te Manaaki, Auckland's Giant Christmas Tree Main menu (Mega) Events Today Tomorrow This Week This Weekend What's On This Month Food & Drink Events Festivals Theatre Exhibitions Music Events Dining Breakfast Lunch Dinner Dessert Cafés Cheap Eats Chinese Korean Japanese Vegan & Vegetarian Bars & Nightlife Bars Open Air Bars Happy Hour Pubs Clubs Live Music Shopping Womens Fashion Menswear Streetwear Shoes Kids Health & Wellbeing Yoga studios Pilates Studios Nail Bars Hair Salons Gyms Arts & Culture Galleries & Museums Music Public Art Activities Entertainment Activities Getting Active Free Things To Do Parking & Transport Buses Ferries Trains Parking Precincts Britomart Aotea Arts Quarter Federal & Elliott Street Fort Street Area Queen Street Viaduct & Waterfront Wynyard Quarter City Works Depot High Street District Victoria Park Neighbourhoods Commercial Bay Albert Street Area Elliott Street Federal Street Lorne Street Silo Park & North Wharf The Viaduct Chancery Square Vulcan Lane Visit New In The City The Transforming City City Centre Map Hotels Special Offers Activities Attractions Bars and nightlife Dining Health and wellbeing Shopping Fullers Ferry Auckland's leading ferry operator Add to favourites 99 Quay Street, +64 9 367 9111 Website Email Show on map Activities There’s nothing Fullers360 loves more than being able to call the Hauraki Gulf home. But sharing it with others comes pretty close. Fullers360 has been the leading ferry operator in Auckland for more than 35 years, connecting locals and visitors to the most sought-after coastal and island destinations. Fullers360 offers a range of ferry trips, tours and charters around Auckland Harbour and islands further afield. Explore the historic seaside suburb of Devonport, hike the volcanic Rangitoto Island, or for an eco-adventure, sail to the wildlife sanctuaries of Tiritiri Matangi Island and Rotoroa Island. Discover Waiheke Island by connecting straight from the ferry to your choice of Fullers360 sightseeing, wine and culinary tours. Flat fee of $7.50 per day on weekends at Fanshawe Street carpark. Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Monday: 9:00 am-5:00 pm Tuesday: 9:00 am-5:00 pm Wednesday: 9:00 am-5:00 pm Thursday: 9:00 am-5:00 pm Friday: 9:00 am-5:00 pm Saturday: 9:00 am-5:00 pm Sunday: Closed Website Facebook Email Show on map Attractions Auckland Tourist Attractions Travel Information and booking “For Kiwi’s – by Kiwi’s” FlexiToursNZ is New Zealand owned and operated. FlexiTours are both Travel Agents + Tour Operators specializing in Travel in New Zealand. Our team has over 40 years combined experience and have tours and travel products to suit all people. You can book through our website or come in and speak to one of our skilled and friendly team members for more personal service Email us on [email protected] or come into our office in Queens Arcade. We have done the research and can save you time, stress and most likely some money by organizing your holiday or trip in post COVID New Zealand. FlexiToursNZ are also now “The Official Domestic and Inbound Travel Partner of New Zealand Golf” and offer a wider range of golf holidays + 1 day excursions in conjunction with our traditional General New Zealand travel products. We have group tours on small coaches, self-drive options in your own car and rental vehicle options. We are official agents for Intercity, Transcenic trains, Interislander and Blue Bridge Ferries, Fullers Ferries and many more. You will never pay more for these services if you book through us, but if anything goes wrong, or you need a last minute change all you will need to do is call us. Get $2.50 parking per hour to a maximum of $15.50 on evenings and weekends at the Downtown car park . Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Previous Next Norma Taps A new kind of sustainable drinking and dining Add to favourites 90 Wellesley Street West, Opening hours Currently closed Monday: Closed Tuesday: 4:00 pm-9:00 pm Wednesday: 12:00 pm-9:00 pm Thursday: 12:00 pm-11:00 pm Friday: 12:00 pm-Late Saturday: 12:30 pm-Late Sunday: 12:30 pm-7:00 pm Instagram Website Show on map Bars and Nightlife Bars Norma Taps embodies the fusion of sustainability and innovation, heralding a revolutionary era of eco-conscious indulgence. Conceived and meticulously crafted by the team at Honest, Norma Taps champions a fresh approach to sustainable wining and dining. Their commitment to eliminating single-use bottles not only reduces waste and expedites service but also delivers unparalleled quality across their handcrafted cocktails, premium spirits, craft beers, wines, and non-alcoholic options. Upon entering this thoughtfully designed space, you'll discover a visual masterpiece: soaring ceilings, bathed in natural light, a harmonious blend of mahogany and cream steel interior walls, and tasteful accents of green velvet and leather flawlessly uniting mid-century and industrial brutalist styles. Drawing inspiration from Japanese listening rooms, they've even incorporated a vinyl record player and an eclectic record collection to enhance the ambiance. This venue serves as a testament to the art of creating unforgettable moments, providing the perfect backdrop for savouring your cocktail, coffee, or dinner. In collaboration with the creative minds behind Passa Passa, the menu showcases exquisite Italian cuisine and delectable bar snacks that perfectly complement the bar's innovative ethos. Norma Taps isn't merely revolutionising how beverages are served; it's elevating the entire bar experience. It transcends being just a place to have a drink; it's a destination where innovation and design converge, crafting an environment that goes beyond the ordinary. Passa Passa images are indicative only. Then this ones for you. Taking inspiration from entertainers around the world, from Chicago Swing Bands to London’s Live Jukebox bars, our favourite pinch-me moments still come from seeing our customers, singing and dancing to our incredibly talented local artists who take the stage every weekend. Every Thursday, Friday and Saturday; Thursday - Jukebox Live from 8pm - learn more here Friday & Saturday - DJs & bands from 10pm Enjoy two hours of free parking or $5 evening and weekend rates. Then this ones for you. Taking inspiration from entertainers around the world, from Chicago Swing Bands to London’s Live Jukebox bars, our favourite pinch-me moments still come from seeing our customers, singing and dancing to our incredibly talented local artists who take the stage every weekend. Every Thursday, Friday and Saturday; Thursday - Jukebox Live from 8pm - learn more here Friday & Saturday - DJs & bands from 10pm Enjoy two hours of free parking or $5 evening and weekend rates. Find out more . Ride on public transport from as little as $2 each way. Find out more . Monday: 8:00 am-7:00 pm Tuesday: 8:00 am-7:00 pm Wednesday: 8:00 am-7:00 pm Thursday: 8:00 am-7:00 pm Friday: 8:00 am-7:00 pm Saturday: 8:00 am-7:00 pm Sunday: 8:00 am-7:00 pm Website Facebook Show on map Attractions Auckland Tourist Attractions Explore is a multi-award-winning company offering an exciting range of sailing and cruising experiences in Auckland on the Waitemata Harbour and Hauraki Gulf. What better way to experience the City of Sails, than out on the water! Select from the many experiences Explore offer; Sail an authentic America’s Cup Yacht, feel the wind in your hair on an Auckland Harbour Sailing Experience, discover island sanctuaries brimming with wildlife or journey through the spectacular Hauraki Gulf marine park dotted with islands and spot marine mammals in their natural habitat. There really is an experience to suit everyone. Plus catch helpful ferry services to popular destinations like Waiheke. All of Explore’s experiences depart from the viaduct in the central city. Flat fee of $7.50 per day on weekends at Fanshawe Street carpark. Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Attractions Auckland Tourist Attractions Activities Viaduct & Waterfront The Viaduct Waterfront Weekends $$$ Last updated: 14 August 2025 Add to favourites In the neighbourhood Viaduct & Waterfront Maritime Car Park Maritime Car Park is a top-quality covered parking facility on Pakenham Street East in the city centre. Add to favourites Viaduct & Waterfront Siri Thai Spa Step out of the hustle & bustle of the city into Siri Thai Spa. Welcome to Siri Thai Spa's sanctuary of peace and restoration... Add to favourites Viaduct & Waterfront Boracay Garden Get the genuine taste of authentic Filipino cuisine while enjoying the warm and friendly service and ambience of Boracay... Add to favourites Viaduct & Waterfront Esther QT Hotels & Resorts signature restaurant 'Esther' in collaboration with Chef Sean Connolly set to open this November. Monday: 6:00 am-11:45 pm Tuesday: 6:00 am-11:45 pm Wednesday: 6:00 am-11:45 pm Thursday: 6:00 am-11:45 pm Friday: 6:00 am-11:45 pm Saturday: 6:00 am-11:45 pm Sunday: 6:00 am-11:45 pm Website Show on map Activities Getting Active Auckland Waterfront Bikes have 18 bikes at 3 locations, courtesy of IBM, Bayleys, Fonterra and Panuku Development. Signed up riders pay $4 for a four weeks subscription, and get the first 1 hour of every ride at $0. At the end of the four weeks, a new four-week subscription will be purchased, but only at the next rental. These bikes are a brilliant way to get to meetings or catch up with friends for lunch in another part of the city. Free parking for your first hour at Jellicoe Street car park. See more here . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Monday: 6:00 am-11:45 pm Tuesday: 6:00 am-11:45 pm Wednesday: 6:00 am-11:45 pm Thursday: 6:00 am-11:45 pm Friday: 6:00 am-11:45 pm Saturday: 6:00 am-11:45 pm Sunday: 6:00 am-11:45 pm Website Show on map Activities Getting Active Auckland Waterfront Bikes have 18 bikes at 3 locations, courtesy of IBM, Bayleys, Fonterra and Panuku Development. Signed up riders pay $4 for a four weeks subscription, and get the first 1 hour of every ride at $0. At the end of the four weeks, a new four-week subscription will be purchased, but only at the next rental. These bikes are a brilliant way to get to meetings or catch up with friends for lunch in another part of the city. Free parking for your first hour at Jellicoe Street car park. See more here . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Monday: 5:30 am-9:00 pm Tuesday: 5:30 am-9:00 pm Wednesday: 5:30 am-9:00 pm Thursday: 5:30 am-9:00 pm Friday: 5:30 am-9:00 pm Saturday: 7:00 am-7:00 pm Sunday: 7:00 am-7:00 pm Website Show on map Attractions Once again a grand building after its refurbishment in 2012, 'T he Teps' proudly shows glimpses of its past while being sleek, modern and again ready to train champions . Poolside cabanas and heritage-inspired tiling, which pay tribute to the baths’ 100-year history, feature alongside state-of-the-art gym equipment, and pump and filter systems. Regardless of age or ability, you and your family are encouraged to learn to swim at the Tepid Baths. Everyone is welcome in their specially catered swim classes that range to meet individual abilities. Professional instructors will take you through a step-by-step programme that will give you skills and confidence to enjoy the water. The stand alone gym is equipped with cutting edge cardio, and weight equipment. With the ability to watch SKY TV on the cardio machines, you can work out while keeping abreast of your favourite programmes. Flat fee of $7.50 per day on weekends at Fanshawe Street carpark. Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . A superior niche venue, hosting everything from new theatre by top local and international playwrights, to international micro circuses, to local dance have all graced the Herald stage. It also plays host to some of the more theatrical shows at the New Zealand International Comedy Festival. You will find Herald Theatre at the northern end of the Aotea Centre.
