Monday: 6:30 am-11:00 pm Tuesday: 6:30 am-11:00 pm Wednesday: 6:30 am-11:00 pm Thursday: 6:30 am-11:00 pm Friday: 11:00 am-11:00 pm Saturday: 11:00 am-11:00 pm Sunday: 11:00 am-11:00 pm Website Instagram Show on map Activities Sports Activities Located in the heart of Britomart, Flush Golf redefines the urban golf experience. They have fused a state-of-art virtual club - featuring five Trackman simulators and coaching from industry experts - with the exceptional social atmosphere of adjoining Bar Ziti . The gallery features a regularly evolving programme of exhibitions and represent over thirty established artists from New Zealand and abroad. Gow Langsford was set up by Gary Langsford and John Gow in 1987. For over 35 years, the gallery has fostered and promoted the best contemporary art from New Zealand and abroad, cultivating an engaged audience and collector base. Gow Langsford has developed into one of New Zealand's most influential dealer galleries, having mounted some 500 exhibitions over the past three decades. The gallery consistently strives to provide a forum through which its artists may be exposed to local, national and international audiences. This includes a regular and varied exhibition schedule as well as frequent participation at major international art events. $2.50 per hour to a max of $12.50 on weekends and a $12.50 flat rate for weekday evenings at The Civic car park. The gallery features a regularly evolving programme of exhibitions and represent over thirty established artists from New Zealand and abroad. Gow Langsford was set up by Gary Langsford and John Gow in 1987. For over 35 years, the gallery has fostered and promoted the best contemporary art from New Zealand and abroad, cultivating an engaged audience and collector base. Gow Langsford has developed into one of New Zealand's most influential dealer galleries, having mounted some 500 exhibitions over the past three decades. The gallery consistently strives to provide a forum through which its artists may be exposed to local, national and international audiences. This includes a regular and varied exhibition schedule as well as frequent participation at major international art events. $2.50 per hour to a max of $12.50 on weekends and a $12.50 flat rate for weekday evenings at The Civic car park. Find out more . Quinn Bar is an elevated cocktail spot, designed for intimate get-togethers, and show stopping cocktails. Their cocktail menu features imaginative takes on classics and entirely new creations, it's the perfect pre-dinner (and post-dinner!) spot. With options including, infused smoked whiskey, an oyster surprise, a pineapple infusion that that surprises your taste buds & so much more! The ever-changing lighting scheme takes this cosy space from after work drinks to intimate late-night catch ups and has a touch of class to its sleek decor. Able to fit less than 50 people and accommodates private functions. Walk-ins are welcome, though you can also book your spot, so you don't have to wait! Get $2.50 parking per hour to a maximum of $15.50 on evenings and weekends at the Downtown car park . Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Climb aboard the Beercycle — a one-of-a-kind, 15-person pedal-powered bar on wheels — and turn any gathering into a rolling celebration. Whether you're planning a work do, birthday bash, or a stag or hens night, Beercycle brings the fun wherever it goes. No drinks while pedaling? No worries! Each stop along the way features exclusive drink specials, making every pause a party in itself. With epic tunes, a dedicated driver, and space for up to 15 party people, Beercycle is built for good times. Four wheels and unlimited memories — the bigger the crew, the better the vibe! Free parking for your first hour at Jellicoe Street car park. See more here . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Climb aboard the Beercycle — a one-of-a-kind, 15-person pedal-powered bar on wheels — and turn any gathering into a rolling celebration. Whether you're planning a work do, birthday bash, or a stag or hens night, Beercycle brings the fun wherever it goes. No drinks while pedaling? No worries! Each stop along the way features exclusive drink specials, making every pause a party in itself. With epic tunes, a dedicated driver, and space for up to 15 party people, Beercycle is built for good times. Four wheels and unlimited memories — the bigger the crew, the better the vibe! Free parking for your first hour at Jellicoe Street car park. See more here . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . description: Transport yourself to the tropics with Bar Mea’s , a bold tribute to Trader Vic’s iconic original. Crafted with the rare Appleton Estate 17-Year-Old rum, Dry Curacao, Orgeat, and Lime, this cocktail captures the vibrant spirit of the classic with a refined, masterful twist. © 2012 - 2025 Heart of the City. All rights reserved.
categories: Holey Moley Golf Club and Karaoke Room

From competition and award-winning mixologists Adam Neal and Jason Rosen, the brains behind rooftop hotspot, Parasol & Swing, Mea is the newest kid on the block in Auckland’s Viaduct. Mea is a collaboration with Appleton Estate, and one of only three venues in New Zealand offering Appleton Estate’s rare, limited-edition 17-Year-Old Legend rum. The intimate, modern bar seats just 14 patrons, so be sure to get in quick! Mea offers an at-bar service experience inviting guests to witness the artistry behind every cocktail, with a little bit of history along the way. This experience is partially inspired by the old Ponsonby icon, Mea Culpa, which Jason owned at the time Parasol & Swing was opened. The curated menu of forgotten classics and bespoke modern cocktails includes Appleton Estate’s famous 17-Year-Old Mai Tai, made from Appleton Estate’s 17-Year-Old Legend – one of the most sought-after spirits in cocktail history. Only 1,500 bottles of this rum were produced globally, with just 23 made available in New Zealand – and Mea is the only bar in Auckland to offer it. Spotlight on ... Appleton Estate "17yo Mai Tai" Bar Mea Transport yourself to the tropics with Bar Mea’s 17YO Mai Tai , a bold tribute to Trader Vic’s iconic original. Crafted with the rare Appleton Estate 17-Year-Old rum, Dry Curacao, Orgeat, and Lime, this cocktail captures the vibrant spirit of the classic with a refined, masterful twist. Flat fee of $7.50 per day on weekends at Fanshawe Street carpark. Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . The curated menu of forgotten classics and bespoke modern cocktails includes Appleton Estate’s famous 17-Year-Old Mai Tai, made from Appleton Estate’s 17-Year-Old Legend – one of the most sought-after spirits in cocktail history. Only 1,500 bottles of this rum were produced globally, with just 23 made available in New Zealand – and Mea is the only bar in Auckland to offer it. Spotlight on ... Appleton Estate "17yo Mai Tai" Bar Mea Transport yourself to the tropics with Bar Mea’s 17YO Mai Tai , a bold tribute to Trader Vic’s iconic original. Crafted with the rare Appleton Estate 17-Year-Old rum, Dry Curacao, Orgeat, and Lime, this cocktail captures the vibrant spirit of the classic with a refined, masterful twist. Flat fee of $7.50 per day on weekends at Fanshawe Street carpark. Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . With a 300 capacity and a team of experienced professionals dedicated to bringing the best live music experience to their patrons, they're the perfect destination for music lovers of all stripes. At AUX, they pride themselves on offering a diverse range of music styles, from Hip Hop to Rock n Roll and everything in between. Whether you're a seasoned concert-goer or someone who's just discovering the thrill of live music, AUX is the perfect destination for you. Their intimate setting and top-quality performance space ensures that you'll never forget your experience there. Andrew Andrew is stylish and classic by early evening and a real party bar at night with a late night closing of 3am. Over 140 years old and still remains an Auckland Iconic landmark of yesteryear. They offer a real kiwi experience with traditional kiwi hospitality with the beautiful Tavern, Restaurant and Function Centre on the ground and basement floors and awesome mid-budget accommodation on the upper three levels all our rooms have ensuites with digital Tv and free unlimited WIFI. Enjoy two hours of free parking or $5 evening and weekend rates. Find out more . Ride on public transport from as little as $2 each way. Find out more . Monday: 7:00 am-Late Tuesday: 7:00 am-Late Wednesday: 7:00 am-Late Thursday: 7:00 am-Late Friday: 7:00 am-Late Saturday: 7:00 am-Late Sunday: 7:00 am-Late Website Facebook Show on map Bars and Nightlife Bars The Albion Pub Hotel was built in 1873, is one of New Zealand’s oldest standing historic Pub Hotels located in the heart of Auckland City. Over 140 years old and still remains an Auckland Iconic landmark of yesteryear. They offer a real kiwi experience with traditional kiwi hospitality with the beautiful Tavern, Restaurant and Function Centre on the ground and basement floors and awesome mid-budget accommodation on the upper three levels all our rooms have ensuites with digital Tv and free unlimited WIFI. Enjoy two hours of free parking or $5 evening and weekend rates. Find out more . Ride on public transport from as little as $2 each way. Find out more . Bars and Nightlife Bars Last updated: 29 October 2021 Add to favourites In the neighbourhood Aotea Arts Quarter Sierra Café Perfectly situated on Lorne Street with plenty of seating inside and a few outside too. Discover a modern vintage parlour of sunken leather lounges, a wide range of single batch spirits and uninterrupted views over the Auckland skyline! Located on the 38th floor of voco Auckland City Centre, Bar Albert is the perfect location to soak in breathtaking views as you sip on an expertly crafted cocktail or smooth single malt whisky. Whether you're meeting with friends or meeting for business, Bar Albert is set to impress. Bookings can be taken directly for groups of up to 10 people. Larger groups looking for a private space to celebrate and enjoy the views can book Bar Albert’s adjoining Wyndham Room, with a minimum spend required. Open Wednesday through Sunday, the stylish scene is set with dark and moody finishes to allow the eye to focus on the harbour and city views. Taking cues from Esther's Mediterranean-inspired menu, mezze snacks mix in Middle Eastern and Spanish flavours from flatbread pizzas packed with local vegetables to rosemary-marinated lamb souvlaki, plus croquetas, falafel, and borek. Featuring a rotating selection of craft cocktails, signature tipples will include watermelon frosé and two custom-made tap selections, starting with a nitro espresso martini. A focus on sustainability, Aquafaba replaces egg whites in cocktail recipes, and spirit selections are delivered in refillable bottles to reduce waste. Thursday, Friday and Saturday nights feature rotating DJ sets by Auckland's top talent, with early evening hours mixing in instrumentals like Matt Bizzle's saxophone and Pixie Lane's percussion, and transitioning to the sounds from Thommy, Andy JV and Paris is Burning for a more electric vibe. With a capacity of 200, the space features indoor-outdoor flow and lounge-style seating, with intimate tables for two and open areas to unwind with friends. Special offers at Rooftop at QT High Noon 4 OCT - 28 DEC, 2025 Kick off your weekend with a shared feast in the sky—croquetas, Speckle Park sirloin, and stunning views, paired with Cloudy Bay or Pelorus bubbles. Available Saturdays and Sundays from 12–3pm, $59 per person . Upcoming Events at Rooftop at QT 1 result 31 DEC 2025 Speakeasy Masquerade NYE Party Hit level six and slip into a night of forbidden glamour. Add to favourites Flat fee of $7.50 per day on weekends at Fanshawe Street carpark. Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Open Wednesday through Sunday, the stylish scene is set with dark and moody finishes to allow the eye to focus on the harbour and city views. Taking cues from Esther's Mediterranean-inspired menu, mezze snacks mix in Middle Eastern and Spanish flavours from flatbread pizzas packed with local vegetables to rosemary-marinated lamb souvlaki, plus croquetas, falafel, and borek. Featuring a rotating selection of craft cocktails, signature tipples will include watermelon frosé and two custom-made tap selections, starting with a nitro espresso martini. A focus on sustainability, Aquafaba replaces egg whites in cocktail recipes, and spirit selections are delivered in refillable bottles to reduce waste. Thursday, Friday and Saturday nights feature rotating DJ sets by Auckland's top talent, with early evening hours mixing in instrumentals like Matt Bizzle's saxophone and Pixie Lane's percussion, and transitioning to the sounds from Thommy, Andy JV and Paris is Burning for a more electric vibe. With a capacity of 200, the space features indoor-outdoor flow and lounge-style seating, with intimate tables for two and open areas to unwind with friends. Special offers at Rooftop at QT High Noon 4 OCT - 28 DEC, 2025 Kick off your weekend with a shared feast in the sky—croquetas, Speckle Park sirloin, and stunning views, paired with Cloudy Bay or Pelorus bubbles. Available Saturdays and Sundays from 12–3pm, $59 per person . Upcoming Events at Rooftop at QT 1 result 31 DEC 2025 Speakeasy Masquerade NYE Party Hit level six and slip into a night of forbidden glamour. Add to favourites Flat fee of $7.50 per day on weekends at Fanshawe Street carpark. Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . If you haven't already heard of it, Good George is originally a brewery based in Hamilton, created by a group of friends who wanted to make beer (good beer!). Their dreams came true and they have since won several awards that prove their status as experts in great brews. What's better than enjoying a craft beer by the water? We'll see you there! Special offers at The Good George Brewery Sunday Sunset Sessions SUNDAYS | 3 - 6PM Enjoy live music from 3 - 6pm with Happy Hour drink deals. $32 Burger & Brew Wednesdays WEDNESDAYS, 11AM - 3PM Brighten up your hump day with a juicy burger and a delicious brew or cider for just $32. George's Explorers Beer Club EVERY 3RD THURSDAY OF THE MONTH Join the flavour expedition at George’s Explorers – The North Wharf Beer Club! For just $24, you’ll get three drinks to sample the best of their range, including exclusive limited-edition brews, featured cocktails, and complimentary snacks to keep your taste buds on their toes. Friday Jugs & Jams FRIDAYS | 4 - 7PM From 4 - 7pm every Friday enjoy $25 select jugs or ciders and high quality jams to start your weekend right. Sundae Sundays for Kids SUNDAYS Enjoy free sundae upgrade with every kids meal on Sundays! Happy Hour SUNDAYS - THURSDAYS | 3-6pm Kick back at Good George with Happy Hour deals that hit just right—every Sunday to Thursday from 3–6pm . Sip on your favourites with $12, $14 & $16 drink specials and soak up the waterfront vibes without breaking the bank. Free parking for your first hour at Jellicoe Street car park. See more here . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . If you haven't already heard of it, Good George is originally a brewery based in Hamilton, created by a group of friends who wanted to make beer (good beer!). Their dreams came true and they have since won several awards that prove their status as experts in great brews. What's better than enjoying a craft beer by the water? We'll see you there! Special offers at The Good George Brewery Sunday Sunset Sessions SUNDAYS | 3 - 6PM Enjoy live music from 3 - 6pm with Happy Hour drink deals. $32 Burger & Brew Wednesdays WEDNESDAYS, 11AM - 3PM Brighten up your hump day with a juicy burger and a delicious brew or cider for just $32. George's Explorers Beer Club EVERY 3RD THURSDAY OF THE MONTH Join the flavour expedition at George’s Explorers – The North Wharf Beer Club! For just $24, you’ll get three drinks to sample the best of their range, including exclusive limited-edition brews, featured cocktails, and complimentary snacks to keep your taste buds on their toes. Friday Jugs & Jams FRIDAYS | 4 - 7PM From 4 - 7pm every Friday enjoy $25 select jugs or ciders and high quality jams to start your weekend right. Sundae Sundays for Kids SUNDAYS Enjoy free sundae upgrade with every kids meal on Sundays! Happy Hour SUNDAYS - THURSDAYS | 3-6pm Kick back at Good George with Happy Hour deals that hit just right—every Sunday to Thursday from 3–6pm . Sip on your favourites with $12, $14 & $16 drink specials and soak up the waterfront vibes without breaking the bank. Free parking for your first hour at Jellicoe Street car park. See more here . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Nestled in the heart of Queen Street, The Curator's Lounge beckons connoisseurs and newcomers alike to experience a haven of refined tastes and impeccable ambiance. As you enter, you'll be enveloped by an atmosphere that exudes class and elegance, with plush leather seating, soft lighting, and a curated selection of spirits that will leave you breathless. Available for exclusive hire any night of the week, The Cellar Bar is entirely yours for an unforgettable event. Staying true to our roots, The Cellar Bar has welcoming Irish-inspired interiors, but with a sophisticated underground edge where your guests can enjoy a private evening of celebration. If you've ever wanted to recreate your own legendary Danny’s experience, all to yourself, now you can! With a full bar, wine and cocktail lists, function catering packages available and space to accommodate your choice of entertainment, this is the only private-hire option of its kind right in the heart of the Viaduct’s party precinct. Located below Danny Doolan’s, The Cellar Bar also transforms into a late-night party hub to extend the good times for more weekend revellers who want to enjoy all the iconic energy and atmosphere of Danny’s on Friday and Saturday nights. Flat fee of $7.50 per day on weekends at Fanshawe Street carpark. Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Perched atop One Queen Street, Queens Rooftop and Wineshop boasts stunning 270-degree views, a seafood bar featuring the freshest kaimoana, live DJ sets and so much more. Venture into the unassuming Queens Wineshop where a discreet elevator hidden behind wine racks will whisk you 21 stories up, where breathtaking views over Waitematā Harbour await. The menu reinvents classic flavours in inventive ways, from a potato and egg trifle and a refined snapper schnitzel through to snacks like smoked pork belly skewers and calamari. If you're a seafood lover, the raw bar, featuring the finest local seafood will be right up your alley. Plus, keep your eyes peeled for the breakfast menu coming soon! The drinks menu features innovative cocktails drawing inspiration from international trends whilst utilising contemporary mixology techniques and fresh, seasonal New Zealand produce. There is also a broad selection of wines and beers, perfect for enjoying those stellar rooftop sunsets. The space promises a sophisticated yet welcoming vibe, making it perfect for any occasion—be it morning coffee meetings or late-night cocktails. See the all day menu here . Breakfast menu coming soon. Perched atop One Queen Street, Queens Rooftop and Wineshop boasts stunning 270-degree views, a seafood bar featuring the freshest kaimoana, live DJ sets and so much more. Venture into the unassuming Queens Wineshop where a discreet elevator hidden behind wine racks will whisk you 21 stories up, where breathtaking views over Waitematā Harbour await. The menu reinvents classic flavours in inventive ways, from a potato and egg trifle and a refined snapper schnitzel through to snacks like smoked pork belly skewers and calamari. If you're a seafood lover, the raw bar, featuring the finest local seafood will be right up your alley. Plus, keep your eyes peeled for the breakfast menu coming soon! The drinks menu features innovative cocktails drawing inspiration from international trends whilst utilising contemporary mixology techniques and fresh, seasonal New Zealand produce. There is also a broad selection of wines and beers, perfect for enjoying those stellar rooftop sunsets. The space promises a sophisticated yet welcoming vibe, making it perfect for any occasion—be it morning coffee meetings or late-night cocktails. See the all day menu here . Breakfast menu coming soon. Nestled on the picturesque Princes Wharf, this cosy and intimate urban cellar door experience is a haven for those seeking a taste of New Zealand's most iconic wineries. With a carefully curated selection of wines from Church Road, Martinborough Vineyard, Te Kairanga, Vavasour, and Mt Difficulty, Somm's cellar door concept offers guests the chance to explore and appreciate the best of New Zealand's acclaimed wine regions without ever having to leave the city. Led by Executive Chef Gavin Doyle of SOUL Bar & Bistro , the food menu at Somm is just as tantalizing. Indulge in irresistible snacks, pizzas, and sharing plates, all expertly crafted to complement your wine of choice. Gavin's menu is regional and seasonal, featuring the finest ingredients sourced from local suppliers. Think market fish crudo, crab apple and goat cheese salad, duck liver toast, Wagyu rump with caviar, crispy fried chicken, and a range of outstanding pizzas - all perfect for pairing with your favourite glass of wine. The fit-out of Somm is nothing short of impressive. Warm lighting, natural materials, and rich textures create an open yet intimate space that exudes inner-city winery vibes. With a variety of seating options, including high leaners, banquettes, and communal tasting tables, Somm is the perfect spot to suit every mood and occasion. Whether you're in the mood for a glass after work, a wine flight on the weekend, or a bottle to share with friends, Somm is the perfect spot. With its unique wine flight menu and extensive catalogue of library wines, Somm is sure to become Auckland's home of wine, capturing the ceremony of a regional cellar door with the comfort of a local wine bar. So why not come and experience the magic of Somm for yourself? You won't be disappointed! Special offers at Somm Wine Bar & Bistro Somm Sundowns DAILY, 4-6PM Sip, savour and soak in the sunshine with specially priced drinks from 4-6pm every day. Your daily happy hour escape. Spotlight on ... Prosciutto & Pecorino Croquettes Somm Wine Bar & Bistro IYKYK - these croquettes are a staple on Somm's menu and for a good reason. Their walnut mustard sauce is a game changer. Nestled on the picturesque Princes Wharf, this cosy and intimate urban cellar door experience is a haven for those seeking a taste of New Zealand's most iconic wineries. With a carefully curated selection of wines from Church Road, Martinborough Vineyard, Te Kairanga, Vavasour, and Mt Difficulty, Somm's cellar door concept offers guests the chance to explore and appreciate the best of New Zealand's acclaimed wine regions without ever having to leave the city. Led by Executive Chef Gavin Doyle of SOUL Bar & Bistro , the food menu at Somm is just as tantalizing. Indulge in irresistible snacks, pizzas, and sharing plates, all expertly crafted to complement your wine of choice. Gavin's menu is regional and seasonal, featuring the finest ingredients sourced from local suppliers. Think market fish crudo, crab apple and goat cheese salad, duck liver toast, Wagyu rump with caviar, crispy fried chicken, and a range of outstanding pizzas - all perfect for pairing with your favourite glass of wine. The fit-out of Somm is nothing short of impressive. Warm lighting, natural materials, and rich textures create an open yet intimate space that exudes inner-city winery vibes. With a variety of seating options, including high leaners, banquettes, and communal tasting tables, Somm is the perfect spot to suit every mood and occasion. Whether you're in the mood for a glass after work, a wine flight on the weekend, or a bottle to share with friends, Somm is the perfect spot. With its unique wine flight menu and extensive catalogue of library wines, Somm is sure to become Auckland's home of wine, capturing the ceremony of a regional cellar door with the comfort of a local wine bar. So why not come and experience the magic of Somm for yourself? You won't be disappointed! Special offers at Somm Wine Bar & Bistro Somm Sundowns DAILY, 4-6PM Sip, savour and soak in the sunshine with specially priced drinks from 4-6pm every day. Your daily happy hour escape. Spotlight on ... Prosciutto & Pecorino Croquettes Somm Wine Bar & Bistro IYKYK - these croquettes are a staple on Somm's menu and for a good reason. Their walnut mustard sauce is a game changer. In August 2013, Shed 10 reopened as Auckland’s primary cruise ship terminal and events space. The Shed dates back to 1910 and is the only original building that remains on Queens Wharf. It is refurbished to provide a premium events space and a high quality welcome to cruise passengers. It is a Category 1 Historic Place and has the largest solar panel of its kind in New Zealand on its roof. Flat fee of $7.50 per day on weekends at Fanshawe Street carpark. Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Their menu (and karaoke song list) has a little something for everyone, featuring spicy pork rice bowls, Korean noodle soups, dumplings, seaweed rolls, Mala hot pots, and six different kinds of crispy Korean fried chicken! Try a little bit of everything with their $9.99 dishes, $10-$20 meal offers and delicious $12 cocktails! And your after-dinner entertainment is sorted with their karaoke set up ready to give you and your friends your moment in the spotlight! $2.50 per hour to a max of $12.50 on weekends and a $12.50 flat rate for weekday evenings at The Civic car park. Find out more . Their menu (and karaoke song list) has a little something for everyone, featuring spicy pork rice bowls, Korean noodle soups, dumplings, seaweed rolls, Mala hot pots, and six different kinds of crispy Korean fried chicken! Try a little bit of everything with their $9.99 dishes, $10-$20 meal offers and delicious $12 cocktails! And your after-dinner entertainment is sorted with their karaoke set up ready to give you and your friends your moment in the spotlight! $2.50 per hour to a max of $12.50 on weekends and a $12.50 flat rate for weekday evenings at The Civic car park. Find out more . Monday: 7:30 am-4:00 pm Tuesday: 7:30 am-4:00 pm Wednesday: 7:30 am-8:00 pm Thursday: 7:30 am-8:00 pm Friday: 7:30 am-8:00 pm Saturday: Closed Sunday: Closed Website Email Show on map Dining Pre Theatre Dining The Terrace is situated in the heart of Auckland Tamaki Makaurau's arts precinct in the city centre. Located at the main entrance of Aotearoa New Zealand’s leading performing arts venue the Aotea Centre, The Terrace overlooks the Aotea Square - one of the central city’s largest green spaces,and known for its civic and cultural events. The Terrace is a relaxing and spacious space where you can enjoy a leisurely catch-up over a delicious meal or snack with friends and whānau; connect at business meetings with colleagues; or kick back at the end of the day while being part of the creative energy and buzz. Serving fresh and delicious meals as well as tasty share plates, L’affare coffee, and a great selection of local craft beers; The Terrace prides itself on the consistency and diversity of its menu offering, as well as the warmth and manaakitanga (hospitality) offered to all. $2.50 per hour to a max of $12.50 on weekends and a $12.50 flat rate for weekday evenings at The Civic car park. Find out more . Monday: 7:30 am-4:00 pm Tuesday: 7:30 am-4:00 pm Wednesday: 7:30 am-8:00 pm Thursday: 7:30 am-8:00 pm Friday: 7:30 am-8:00 pm Saturday: Closed Sunday: Closed Website Email Show on map Dining Pre Theatre Dining The Terrace is situated in the heart of Auckland Tamaki Makaurau's arts precinct in the city centre. Located at the main entrance of Aotearoa New Zealand’s leading performing arts venue the Aotea Centre, The Terrace overlooks the Aotea Square - one of the central city’s largest green spaces,and known for its civic and cultural events. The Terrace is a relaxing and spacious space where you can enjoy a leisurely catch-up over a delicious meal or snack with friends and whānau; connect at business meetings with colleagues; or kick back at the end of the day while being part of the creative energy and buzz. Serving fresh and delicious meals as well as tasty share plates, L’affare coffee, and a great selection of local craft beers; The Terrace prides itself on the consistency and diversity of its menu offering, as well as the warmth and manaakitanga (hospitality) offered to all. $2.50 per hour to a max of $12.50 on weekends and a $12.50 flat rate for weekday evenings at The Civic car park. Find out more . Run by Martin and Alek, they have both taken their knowledge for wine and turned this space into a cozy, intimate and sophisticated place to be. The perfect spot to grab drinks after work, catch up with friends, or even enjoy a lovely read in a little nook. Get ready to experience the best in football, music, entertainment, food, and matches on the big screen! See the full lineup of activities and entertainment here Originally built for the Rugby World Cup 2011 and located close to the Britomart Transportation Centre and the Auckland Ferry Terminal - the Cloud is in prime real estate as well as being central to the booming precincts of Britomart, and Wynyard Quarter. Visible from the harbour, this visual reference of a cloud, is an emblem synonymous with Aotearoa - 'the land of the long white cloud'. Even once inside the venue you can enjoy magnificent harbour views from the comfort of a weatherproof space. Having been open for the America's Cup final and Rugby World Cup screenings; this really is the place to be for the atmosphere and the crowd if you are sports-mad. The venue is a place where you can play games, and enjoy participating in regular events (ticketed and free) as well as sporting activities and the like. With the capacity to hold a crowd of 5,000 the venue has a mezzanine and can be used in one or all of four parts, fit for various purposes. Get ready to experience the best in football, music, entertainment, food, and matches on the big screen! See the full lineup of activities and entertainment here Originally built for the Rugby World Cup 2011 and located close to the Britomart Transportation Centre and the Auckland Ferry Terminal - the Cloud is in prime real estate as well as being central to the booming precincts of Britomart, and Wynyard Quarter. Visible from the harbour, this visual reference of a cloud, is an emblem synonymous with Aotearoa - 'the land of the long white cloud'. Even once inside the venue you can enjoy magnificent harbour views from the comfort of a weatherproof space. Having been open for the America's Cup final and Rugby World Cup screenings; this really is the place to be for the atmosphere and the crowd if you are sports-mad. The venue is a place where you can play games, and enjoy participating in regular events (ticketed and free) as well as sporting activities and the like. With the capacity to hold a crowd of 5,000 the venue has a mezzanine and can be used in one or all of four parts, fit for various purposes. Upcoming Events at The Cloud 1 result 14 - 15 MAR, 2026 Roots | Auckland Tattoo Convention For two days, The Cloud will transform into a hub of artistry, culture, and connection for the Roots Auckland Tattoo... Te Ao Pūtahi Festival Te Manaaki, Auckland's Giant Christmas Tree Main menu (Mega) Events Today Tomorrow This Week This Weekend What's On This Month Food & Drink Events Festivals Theatre Exhibitions Music Events Dining Breakfast Lunch Dinner Dessert Cafés Cheap Eats Chinese Korean Japanese Vegan & Vegetarian Bars & Nightlife Bars Open Air Bars Happy Hour Pubs Clubs Live Music Shopping Womens Fashion Menswear Streetwear Shoes Kids Health & Wellbeing Yoga studios Pilates Studios Nail Bars Hair Salons Gyms Arts & Culture Galleries & Museums Music Public Art Activities Entertainment Activities Getting Active Free Things To Do Parking & Transport Buses Ferries Trains Parking Precincts Britomart Aotea Arts Quarter Federal & Elliott Street Fort Street Area Queen Street Viaduct & Waterfront Wynyard Quarter City Works Depot High Street District Victoria Park Neighbourhoods Commercial Bay Albert Street Area Elliott Street Federal Street Lorne Street Silo Park & North Wharf The Viaduct Chancery Square Vulcan Lane Visit New In The City The Transforming City City Centre Map Hotels Special Offers Activities Attractions Bars and nightlife Dining Health and wellbeing Shopping Tyler St The new home of sports in the city Add to favourites 46 Tyler Street, Opening hours Currently closed Monday: Closed Tuesday: 12:00 pm-11:00 pm Wednesday: 12:00 pm-11:00 pm Thursday: 12:00 pm-11:00 pm Friday: 12:00 pm-11:00 pm Saturday: 12:00 pm-11:00 pm Sunday: Closed Website Show on map Bars and Nightlife Bars The official home of the Auckland FC football team, the go-to venue for all AFC game days, offering the fans a true-blue experience outside of the stadium. Celebrate sport, and the sporting communities with exceptional hospitality in a sophisticated setting. Tyler St Sport has two large viewing walls, and additional screens throughout the venue connecting you straight to the action. From casual catch-ups to full venue events, Tyler St’s got the space, flavour, and flow. The menu’s built to impress with bar classics (hello, Wagyu cheeseburger), and bold bites for the foodies. Big screens bring the buzz on game days, and the vibe? Always top tier. Join their Happy Hour from Tuesdays to Fridays! Special offers at Tyler St Happy Hour at Tyler St TUES - FRI | 4-7pm Step into Tyler St and enjoy their new happy hour from 4 - 7pm, Tuesdays to Fridays! We legally can't say how good it is - but let's just say they're doing things by halves... Auckland FC Game Day Burger, Beers, Bus Auckland FC Game-Days The fan-favourite AFC Game Day Package is back for every home match this season, delivering the ultimate stress-free football experience. Kick things off with burgers and pints at Tyler St, hop on the return bus to the stadium , then wrap up with post-match beers at AFC HQ. Choose from two options: $60 for the full Burger, Beers & Bus combo , or $35 for Beers & Bus only . Spots are limited for each game—don’t miss out on the AFC buzz! Click here to book your tickets. Park for $2.50 per hour at the Downtown car park to a maximum of $15.50 on evenings and weekends. Find out more . Choose from two options: $60 for the full Burger, Beers & Bus combo , or $35 for Beers & Bus only . Spots are limited for each game—don’t miss out on the AFC buzz! Click here to book your tickets. Park for $2.50 per hour at the Downtown car park to a maximum of $15.50 on evenings and weekends. Find out more . Add to favourites 52 Tyler St, Opening hours Currently closed Monday: Closed Tuesday: Closed Wednesday: 5:00 pm-11:00 pm Thursday: 5:00 pm-11:00 pm Friday: 5:00 pm-1:00 am Saturday: 5:00 pm-1:00 am Sunday: Closed Website Show on map Bars and Nightlife Bars Searching for champagne heaven? We've found it! Tommys Champagne Parlour is a champagne lover's heaven and the perfect place for those looking for a new and intimate spot for drinks with friends, to bring a date, to toast a celebration or relax with colleagues. Located on the sixth floor of the Seaferers Building in Britomart and home to more than 10 champagnes by the flute and 30+ varietals, Tommys, in addition to a stellar champagne and sparkling wine list, also provide a full bar and a menu of their own specialty sparkling cocktails, as well as small plates. With a brand new that oozes elegance and sophistication, and new hours in time for the winter season, Tommys boasts stunning views overlooking Auckland Harbour and Britomart, operating in a space that was once a haven for sailors, seamen and runaways of the sea, back in the 70s. The Seafearers Building once housed numerous cabins for the leery vagabons, including Tommy, an original sailor and resident of the original Seafarers building. Fast forward to more than three decades later, the storytelling continues and Tommys parlour invites patrons to enjoy the same views, cloaked in the room's plush settings and indulge in champagne, cocktails and spirits. Tommys Champagne Parlour history is preserved in its subtle lighting, an impressive champagne list, cocktail menu, intimate booths and private VIP jungle room. Park for $2.50 per hour at the Downtown car park to a maximum of $15.50 on evenings and weekends. Find out more . With live music seven nights a week, night time is always lively and entertaining at Father Ted's. Voted into the top 12 best Irish pubs outside of Ireland by Skyscanner in 2016, Father Ted's was the only venue in New Zealand to make the list! A great place for a pint of Guinness or Kilkenny, there's a large selection of New Zealand beers on tap along with an array of quality spirits and wines. Nestled beneath Queen Street, this bespoke basement lounge reflects the lifelong passions of its founders, showcasing their unique and extensive personal collections of vinyl and whisky. At Kemuri Hi-Fi, great music, delicious drinks and flavourful food come together seamlessly to create an exceptional bar experience. As both a hidden sanctuary and an intimate social hub, Kemuri Hi-Fi offers a refuge from the city's hustle and bustle. Descend underground to enjoy a bespoke high-fidelity sound system playing a diverse range of music. While Kemuri specialises in whisky, the menu also features a highly creative selection of cocktails and delectable food offerings. Additionally, Kemuri hosts intimate tasting sessions at a custom tasting table, offering fine champagne, wine, whisky, and other premium spirits. Open Tuesdays to Saturdays, 4pm till late. Nestled beneath Queen Street, this bespoke basement lounge reflects the lifelong passions of its founders, showcasing their unique and extensive personal collections of vinyl and whisky. At Kemuri Hi-Fi, great music, delicious drinks and flavourful food come together seamlessly to create an exceptional bar experience. As both a hidden sanctuary and an intimate social hub, Kemuri Hi-Fi offers a refuge from the city's hustle and bustle. Descend underground to enjoy a bespoke high-fidelity sound system playing a diverse range of music. While Kemuri specialises in whisky, the menu also features a highly creative selection of cocktails and delectable food offerings. Additionally, Kemuri hosts intimate tasting sessions at a custom tasting table, offering fine champagne, wine, whisky, and other premium spirits. Open Tuesdays to Saturdays, 4pm till late. Image credit: Nick Paulsen Get $2.50 parking per hour to a maximum of $15.50 on evenings and weekends at the Downtown car park . Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Step back in time at Caretaker, a gorgeous cocktail bar, modelled off the classic cocktail lounges of New York, where their philosophy centres around designing drinks around your favourite flavours. After chatting with you about your preferences or what you’re in the mood for, they’ll whip you up a custom cocktail. Every element of the beverages they create has been carefully considered, from the hand carved ice made from filtered water, to the seasonal produce, and the fresh juices pressed behind the bar. The set menu changes weekly, and features some unique original recipes including a beer cocktail from 1864, intriguingly named ‘Blow My Skull’. The moody bar is fitted out with cosy tables, leather seats, smoky mirrors and dark woods, creating an intimate setting to indulge in a drink or two. Caretaker is open 7 days a week from 5pm until 3am. Special offers at Caretaker Live Jazz at Caretaker SUNDAY, MONDAY, TUESDAY from 9PM Order yourself one of Caretaker's famous cocktails, and you can also enjoy live jazz every Sunday, Monday and Tuesday evening from 9pm. Upcoming Events at Caretaker 1 result Sundays 9PM Live Jazz at The Caretaker Sneak on down into The Caretaker's underground speakeasy to enjoy some lively jazz every Sunday, Monday and Tuesday at 9pm... Step back in time at Caretaker, a gorgeous cocktail bar, modelled off the classic cocktail lounges of New York, where their philosophy centres around designing drinks around your favourite flavours. After chatting with you about your preferences or what you’re in the mood for, they’ll whip you up a custom cocktail. Every element of the beverages they create has been carefully considered, from the hand carved ice made from filtered water, to the seasonal produce, and the fresh juices pressed behind the bar. The set menu changes weekly, and features some unique original recipes including a beer cocktail from 1864, intriguingly named ‘Blow My Skull’. The moody bar is fitted out with cosy tables, leather seats, smoky mirrors and dark woods, creating an intimate setting to indulge in a drink or two. Caretaker is open 7 days a week from 5pm until 3am. Special offers at Caretaker Live Jazz at Caretaker SUNDAY, MONDAY, TUESDAY from 9PM Order yourself one of Caretaker's famous cocktails, and you can also enjoy live jazz every Sunday, Monday and Tuesday evening from 9pm. Imagine The Nightcar as a cool twist on Chinese grub. They've got a mix of small, sharable bites – some hot, some cold, with both veggie and meat options, plus a bunch of noodle dishes. It's all designed to amp up your cocktail game, making it a laid-back, tasty combo for a good time. Alongside their food menu is an impressive wine offering and delicious cocktail menu. Think green tea rum with lemon and lychee, jasmine vodka with plum wine, lemon and sour foam, or cognac with five spice, coffee and chocolate. Set under the city's iconic Queen Street, the sophisticated, interior nods to the idea of luxurious train travel. Complete with groovy music and a touch of modern Chinese flair, it's the perfect spot to find yourself on a night out in the city. Special offers at The Nightcar 夜班车 Happy Hour at The NightCar TUESDAYS - SATURDAYS | 5-7PM Unwind at The NightCar’s Happy Hour, running Tuesday to Saturday from 5–7pm , where cocktails are crafted to awaken your senses and kickstart your evening. Each drink showcases Jumping Goat Coffee Liqueur , turning coffee into a rich, aromatic ritual of indulgence and connection. Spotlight on ... Coffee-Inspired Creations The Nightcar 夜班车 To take your after-work ritual to the next level, indulge in The NightCar's special range of coffee-inspired drinks : NightCar Express – infused with Strawberry Syrup, a playful and aromatic twist | Banana Express – a creamy, indulgent blend with banana that awakens the senses | Conductor's Curse – the classic favorite, perfected | Cold War – bold, smooth, and invigorating Get $2.50 parking per hour to a maximum of $15.50 on evenings and weekends at the Downtown car park . Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Founded by the dynamic duo Theo and Yovin, this bar is a celebration of creativity and craft. Theo, the mastermind behind the bar, shakes up daring cocktails that surprise and delight. Yovin brings the heat in the kitchen, serving dishes as bold and flavourful as the drinks. Step into an intimate and sustainably designed space—NZ’s first interactive bar featuring a two-way bar top. Watch your cocktail come to life right before your eyes, and chat with the bartender as they craft each drink with precision and flair. Every pour, shake, and garnish is done in full view, because here, nothing is hidden—just like the best truths. Try signature creations like the Ferrero Rocher cocktail , pair it with the rice pop chicken , and finish with a decadent matcha mousse and strawberry pavlova . Flat fee of $7.50 per day on weekends at Fanshawe Street carpark. Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Add to favourites Fort Street Area Snickel Lane This inner city laneway should be your next destination for quality socialising, eating and drinking. Add to favourites Fort Street Area Altezano Brothers Snickel Lane Snickel Lane's stylish coffee shop serving excellent coffee and treats. Hand-crafted to suit all kinds of occasions, including birthdays, hens nights, corporate and fundraising events. The Aotea Centre is purpose-built performing arts centre, home to New Zealand’s largest tiered auditorium, a unique black box theatre and function rooms. The Maori name “Aotea” has several meanings in English, the most common one being “White Cloud” or “beyond the mist, a new beginning”. Kiri Te Kanawa Theatre and Herald Theatre are host to international and local performers of the highest calibre, as well as emerging talents and schools contests. The space has art work by prominent New Zealand names. There are a raft of performances in the space including by the New Zealand Ballet, New Zealand Symphony Orchestra, and New Zealand Opera. Auckland Writers Festival takes place in the building. Transportation links are aplenty in the streets surrounding the venue, plus many incredible bars and eateries. Te Ao Pūtahi Festival Te Manaaki, Auckland's Giant Christmas Tree Main menu (Mega) Events Today Tomorrow This Week This Weekend What's On This Month Food & Drink Events Festivals Theatre Exhibitions Music Events Dining Breakfast Lunch Dinner Dessert Cafés Cheap Eats Chinese Korean Japanese Vegan & Vegetarian Bars & Nightlife Bars Open Air Bars Happy Hour Pubs Clubs Live Music Shopping Womens Fashion Menswear Streetwear Shoes Kids Health & Wellbeing Yoga studios Pilates Studios Nail Bars Hair Salons Gyms Arts & Culture Galleries & Museums Music Public Art Activities Entertainment Activities Getting Active Free Things To Do Parking & Transport Buses Ferries Trains Parking Precincts Britomart Aotea Arts Quarter Federal & Elliott Street Fort Street Area Queen Street Viaduct & Waterfront Wynyard Quarter City Works Depot High Street District Victoria Park Neighbourhoods Commercial Bay Albert Street Area Elliott Street Federal Street Lorne Street Silo Park & North Wharf The Viaduct Chancery Square Vulcan Lane Visit New In The City The Transforming City City Centre Map Hotels Special Offers Activities Attractions Bars and nightlife Dining Health and wellbeing Shopping Ted Ashby, image supplied by New Zealand Maritime Museum Ted Ashby Sailings New Zealand Maritime Museum Add to favourites New Zealand Maritime Museum , Corner Quay and Hobson Streets 09 373 0800 Opening hours Currently closed Monday: Closed Tuesday: 11:30 am-12:30 pm, 1:30 pm-2:30 pm Wednesday: 11:30 am-12:30 pm, 1:30 pm-2:30 pm Thursday: 11:30 am-12:30 pm, 1:30 pm-2:30 pm Friday: 11:30 am-12:30 pm, 1:30 pm-2:30 pm Saturday: 11:30 am-12:30 pm, 1:30 pm-2:30 pm Sunday: 11:30 am-12:30 pm, 1:30 pm-2:30 pm Website Book Now Show on map Attractions Auckland Tourist Attractions Get out on the water this summer and book a journey aboard the New Zealand Maritime Museum's iconic sailing boat Ted Ashby. Help hoist the sails, then relax and enjoy an hour-long cruise on the sparkling Waitematā Harbour. Sailing dates & times: Tuesday-Sunday 11.30am and 1.30pm Prices: $31 per Auckland Adult (Children $15) $63 per Visitor to Auckland (Children $30) $74 Auckland family pass, $149 visitor family pass About TED ASHBY Ted Ashby is a ketch-rigged deck scow, typical of the fleet of scows that once operated in northern New Zealand waters. Built by Museum staff and volunteers in the traditional manner, she was launched in August 1993. Freightways Ltd sponsored her construction with assistance by many other firms. Ted Ashby is built of blackbutt, an Australian hardwood grown in Northland, instead of the traditional kauri. She is fastened with galvanised steel bolts and spikes. The hull is framed with fore-and-aft bulkheads, known as partitions, and the bottom is cross-planked. Underwater the hull is sheathed in worm-resistant totara over tarred felt and schenam, a mixture of lime and oil. Scows were flat-bottomed, centreboard vessels, most of which carried their cargo on deck. They were ideal for working estuaries and shallow harbours, and they carried logs, firewood, sand and shingle, machinery and stock. A few of the larger scows carried timber to Australia and America. Scows ranged from 45 to 130 foot in length and most were two-masted, ketch or schooner rigged. The largest were three-masted. Some 130 scows were built in the north of New Zealand between 1873 and 1925. The first was the Lake Erie, based on the American Great Lakes scows. New Zealand scows quickly developed their own characteristic form and construction. Today only half a dozen survived. The Maritime Museum chose to name the vessel after Ted Ashby, a man whose whole life was intimately involved with the scows, and the author of the book 'Phantom Fleet'. Flat fee of $7.50 per day on weekends at Fanshawe Street carpark. Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . At 186 metres above street level, Auckland’s most thrilling multi-sensory attraction is at SkyCity Auckland inside the iconic Sky Tower. Feel the thrill of travelling at top speeds as you soar and slide down glass tubes that weave their way all around the Tower. To see Auckland as you never have before, fasten your seatbelts and take SkySlide for a spin. Suitable for ages 5 and up so there’s fun for the whole family. The Sky Tower is the Southern Hemisphere’s tallest free-standing structure. Based in the heart of Auckland, it is one of New Zealand’s most recognisable landmarks. Online Bundle Special ticket price: Save when you book online! Adults $45 (includes Sky Tower admission when you book online) Book now Opening hours: From 9.30am daily Price: $15 on top of your Sky Tower tickets For ages 5+ More important info, here. $2.50 per hour to a max of $12.50 on weekends and a $12.50 flat rate for weekday evenings at The Civic car park. Find out more . At 186 metres above street level, Auckland’s most thrilling multi-sensory attraction is at SkyCity Auckland inside the iconic Sky Tower. Feel the thrill of travelling at top speeds as you soar and slide down glass tubes that weave their way all around the Tower. To see Auckland as you never have before, fasten your seatbelts and take SkySlide for a spin. Suitable for ages 5 and up so there’s fun for the whole family. The Sky Tower is the Southern Hemisphere’s tallest free-standing structure. Based in the heart of Auckland, it is one of New Zealand’s most recognisable landmarks. Online Bundle Special ticket price: Save when you book online! Adults $45 (includes Sky Tower admission when you book online) Book now Opening hours: From 9.30am daily Price: $15 on top of your Sky Tower tickets For ages 5+ More important info, here. $2.50 per hour to a max of $12.50 on weekends and a $12.50 flat rate for weekday evenings at The Civic car park. Find out more . Show on map Attractions Auckland Tourist Attractions The iconic Auckland Dockline Tram is back on track performing its well versed 1.5km loop of Wynyard Quarter. The tram takes passengers along Jellicoe, Halsey, Gaunt and Daldy streets whilst providing live commentary on the sights, attractions and history of the area. The tram route was suspended in August 2018 ahead of the 36th America’s Cup, since then, the area has transformed and there are so many new sights to see, experience and learn about. For a small fee you can purchase an all-day ticket from the tram driver to travel the full loop or hop-on or off at any of the four tram stops. Ticket prices: Adults: $2 Children: $1 SuperGold Card holders and under fives: Free Pay by EFTPOS, credit card or cash only. Operating days: 10am-4pm on Sundays, Public Holidays, Saturdays over long weekends As the tram is considered a tourist attraction and not public transport, payment for the tram must be made by card or cash (AT HOP cards will not be accepted). The announcement of the tram's return comes thanks to a new partnership between the Museum of Transport and Technology (MOTAT) and Panuku Development Auckland, Auckland Council’s urban regeneration agency. Free parking for your first hour at Jellicoe Street car park. See more here . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Each walk is a once-only theatre of the street and there's several types of tours to choose from. Depending on the type of tour you choose, you’ll be guided up back streets and hear entertaining stories at the heart of the city. Sights include Britomart, Auckland’s Town Hall, Art Gallery and a wee climb up a secret city volcano to a long forgotten Māori fortress. Bookings essential. Private tours available. Book online here . Enjoy two hours of free parking or $5 evening and weekend rates. Find out more . Ride on public transport from as little as $2 each way. Find out more . Te Ao Pūtahi Festival Te Manaaki, Auckland's Giant Christmas Tree Main menu (Mega) Events Today Tomorrow This Week This Weekend What's On This Month Food & Drink Events Festivals Theatre Exhibitions Music Events Dining Breakfast Lunch Dinner Dessert Cafés Cheap Eats Chinese Korean Japanese Vegan & Vegetarian Bars & Nightlife Bars Open Air Bars Happy Hour Pubs Clubs Live Music Shopping Womens Fashion Menswear Streetwear Shoes Kids Health & Wellbeing Yoga studios Pilates Studios Nail Bars Hair Salons Gyms Arts & Culture Galleries & Museums Music Public Art Activities Entertainment Activities Getting Active Free Things To Do Parking & Transport Buses Ferries Trains Parking Precincts Britomart Aotea Arts Quarter Federal & Elliott Street Fort Street Area Queen Street Viaduct & Waterfront Wynyard Quarter City Works Depot High Street District Victoria Park Neighbourhoods Commercial Bay Albert Street Area Elliott Street Federal Street Lorne Street Silo Park & North Wharf The Viaduct Chancery Square Vulcan Lane Visit New In The City The Transforming City City Centre Map Hotels Special Offers Activities Attractions Bars and nightlife Dining Health and wellbeing Shopping Fun on Foot with Aucky Walky Guided city tours Add to favourites 10 Queen Street, 021 378 267 Website Email Show on map Activities Walks Join this fun small group walking tour with a friendly Aucklander to discover the city’s diverse beauty, early Māori history and hidden gems. Each walk is a once-only theatre of the street and there's several types of tours to choose from. Depending on the type of tour you choose, you’ll be guided up back streets and hear entertaining stories at the heart of the city. Sights include Britomart, Auckland’s Town Hall, Art Gallery and a wee climb up a secret city volcano to a long forgotten Māori fortress. Bookings essential. Private tours available. Book online here . Enjoy two hours of free parking or $5 evening and weekend rates. Find out more . Ride on public transport from as little as $2 each way. Find out more . Te Ao Pūtahi Festival Te Manaaki, Auckland's Giant Christmas Tree Main menu (Mega) Events Today Tomorrow This Week This Weekend What's On This Month Food & Drink Events Festivals Theatre Exhibitions Music Events Dining Breakfast Lunch Dinner Dessert Cafés Cheap Eats Chinese Korean Japanese Vegan & Vegetarian Bars & Nightlife Bars Open Air Bars Happy Hour Pubs Clubs Live Music Shopping Womens Fashion Menswear Streetwear Shoes Kids Health & Wellbeing Yoga studios Pilates Studios Nail Bars Hair Salons Gyms Arts & Culture Galleries & Museums Music Public Art Activities Entertainment Activities Getting Active Free Things To Do Parking & Transport Buses Ferries Trains Parking Precincts Britomart Aotea Arts Quarter Federal & Elliott Street Fort Street Area Queen Street Viaduct & Waterfront Wynyard Quarter City Works Depot High Street District Victoria Park Neighbourhoods Commercial Bay Albert Street Area Elliott Street Federal Street Lorne Street Silo Park & North Wharf The Viaduct Chancery Square Vulcan Lane Visit New In The City The Transforming City City Centre Map Hotels Special Offers Activities Attractions Bars and nightlife Dining Health and wellbeing Shopping Image via powertothepedal.com Power to the Pedal Electric bike sight seeing tours and rentals in Auckland Add to favourites Park Hyatt Auckland, +64 21 082 94218 Website Facebook Show on map Activities Sports Activities If you're keen to explore Auckland on two wheels then you definitely have to check out Power to the Pedal. The team at Power to the Pedal is committed to showing you the highlights of Auckland, all from a local's perspective. They offer three unique cycling experiences including The Classic, The Inside Loop, The Easy Rider and The City Lights or if you want, they can also create Custom Tours as well. Their bicycles are also available for half day rentals (morning and afternoon) or full day rentals (return by 5.30pm). Made up of a small team who are passionate about Auckland's city centre as well as the joys of cycling, Power to the Pedal have a unique range of electric bicycles that make cycling fun. These bikes have in-built electrical motors that take the 'sweat' out of cycling, allowing you to climb hills with ease and enjoy the sights of your tour instead of focusing on the work of cycling. Power To The Pedal's team will provide you with a demonstration on how you can get the most out of your electric bike before you head out to explore Auckland's cycleways and streets. Free parking for your first hour at Jellicoe Street car park. See more here . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Central City Heritage Loop Walk Add to favourites Auckland Central City Library, More Info Show on map Attractions Auckland Tourist Attractions Are you curious about the city that you live in and wanting to see some buildings through a historic lens? The Central City Heritage Loop traces the story of Tāmaki Makaurau Auckland’s growth through its built environment. Explore some of uptown Queen Street’s most iconic buildings and uncover taonga from Ngā Pātaka Kōrero o Tāmaki Makaurau | Auckland Libraries Heritage Collections that tell the story of the city’s layered past. There are 10 stops in this walk including iconic sites such as the Civic Theatre, Darby Building, the Strand Arcade and more. Download the Walk Auckland app today and explore some of Tāmaki Makaurau’s history and heritage. The walk is titled ‘Central City Heritage Loop’ and each site is GPS mapped appearing on your screen when you are within the area of the site. The walk starts at Central City Library, 44-46 Lorne Street, Auckland 1010. You can use the Wi-Fi in the library to download the Walk Auckland app and the Central City Heritage Loop walking tour. To make this walk more accessible, there is an audio component, and headphones are recommended for the best experience. Starting Point: North side of Lorne Street and Wellesley St E looking back at Tāmaki Pātaka Kōrero | Auckland Central City Library Parking: Civic Carpark 299 Queen Street. Open from 6am or Victoria Street Car Park, 30 Kitchener Street $2.50 per hour to a max of $12.50 on weekends and a $12.50 flat rate for weekday evenings at The Civic car park. Find out more . Te Ao Pūtahi Festival Te Manaaki, Auckland's Giant Christmas Tree Main menu (Mega) Events Today Tomorrow This Week This Weekend What's On This Month Food & Drink Events Festivals Theatre Exhibitions Music Events Dining Breakfast Lunch Dinner Dessert Cafés Cheap Eats Chinese Korean Japanese Vegan & Vegetarian Bars & Nightlife Bars Open Air Bars Happy Hour Pubs Clubs Live Music Shopping Womens Fashion Menswear Streetwear Shoes Kids Health & Wellbeing Yoga studios Pilates Studios Nail Bars Hair Salons Gyms Arts & Culture Galleries & Museums Music Public Art Activities Entertainment Activities Getting Active Free Things To Do Parking & Transport Buses Ferries Trains Parking Precincts Britomart Aotea Arts Quarter Federal & Elliott Street Fort Street Area Queen Street Viaduct & Waterfront Wynyard Quarter City Works Depot High Street District Victoria Park Neighbourhoods Commercial Bay Albert Street Area Elliott Street Federal Street Lorne Street Silo Park & North Wharf The Viaduct Chancery Square Vulcan Lane Visit New In The City The Transforming City City Centre Map Hotels Special Offers Activities Attractions Bars and nightlife Dining Health and wellbeing Shopping Auckland Free Walking Tours Rediscover our glorious city Add to favourites 89 Quay Street, Website Facebook Email Show on map Attractions Auckland Tourist Attractions These centrally located tours are a great way to learn about and explore Auckland City. Let the team of passionate guides who each add their own flavours and stories to their tours to help you get to know the city like a local. Be entertained by unexpected stories, interesting anecdotes, and fun facts. A family friendly event that is great for people looking for an introduction to New Zealand, people who are looking for ideas to plan their trips, people looking to meet other travellers, a way of reflecting on travel around New Zealand, and even those that are local who feel like a day out. Best of all is you pay what you feel the tour is worth, you can’t get better value than that! Booking is essential so that the team can make sure they have enough guides for the group on the day. For more information and booking times check out the Auckland Walking Tours Website . Flat fee of $7.50 per day on weekends at Fanshawe Street carpark. Find out more . Te Ao Pūtahi Festival Te Manaaki, Auckland's Giant Christmas Tree Main menu (Mega) Events Today Tomorrow This Week This Weekend What's On This Month Food & Drink Events Festivals Theatre Exhibitions Music Events Dining Breakfast Lunch Dinner Dessert Cafés Cheap Eats Chinese Korean Japanese Vegan & Vegetarian Bars & Nightlife Bars Open Air Bars Happy Hour Pubs Clubs Live Music Shopping Womens Fashion Menswear Streetwear Shoes Kids Health & Wellbeing Yoga studios Pilates Studios Nail Bars Hair Salons Gyms Arts & Culture Galleries & Museums Music Public Art Activities Entertainment Activities Getting Active Free Things To Do Parking & Transport Buses Ferries Trains Parking Precincts Britomart Aotea Arts Quarter Federal & Elliott Street Fort Street Area Queen Street Viaduct & Waterfront Wynyard Quarter City Works Depot High Street District Victoria Park Neighbourhoods Commercial Bay Albert Street Area Elliott Street Federal Street Lorne Street Silo Park & North Wharf The Viaduct Chancery Square Vulcan Lane Visit New In The City The Transforming City City Centre Map Hotels Special Offers Activities Attractions Bars and nightlife Dining Health and wellbeing Shopping Auckland Free Walking Tours Rediscover our glorious city Add to favourites 89 Quay Street, Website Facebook Email Show on map Attractions Auckland Tourist Attractions These centrally located tours are a great way to learn about and explore Auckland City. Let the team of passionate guides who each add their own flavours and stories to their tours to help you get to know the city like a local. Be entertained by unexpected stories, interesting anecdotes, and fun facts. A family friendly event that is great for people looking for an introduction to New Zealand, people who are looking for ideas to plan their trips, people looking to meet other travellers, a way of reflecting on travel around New Zealand, and even those that are local who feel like a day out. Best of all is you pay what you feel the tour is worth, you can’t get better value than that! Booking is essential so that the team can make sure they have enough guides for the group on the day. For more information and booking times check out the Auckland Walking Tours Website . Flat fee of $7.50 per day on weekends at Fanshawe Street carpark. Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Monday: 8:00 am-7:00 pm Tuesday: 8:00 am-7:00 pm Wednesday: 8:00 am-7:00 pm Thursday: 8:00 am-7:00 pm Friday: 8:00 am-7:00 pm Saturday: 8:00 am-7:00 pm Sunday: 8:00 am-7:00 pm Website Facebook Show on map Attractions Auckland Tourist Attractions Auckland Seaplanes is a re-established seaplane operation in the Waterfront Auckland area. They provide scenic flights, island lunches, adventure trips, island-hopping experiences, island escapes and charter services over the breath-taking land of Aotearoa. Their De Havilland Beaver Floatplane comfortably seats 6 adults to breath-taking Island destinations. Scenic flights give a unique experience as you fly over the mesmerizing Hauraki Gulf Islands and volcano. Additionally you and your friends could go for an island get-away for lunch or a wine tasting on Waiheke Island. They also offer transfers, adventure trips and charter services to destinations such as Great Barrier Island, Kawau, Rakino, Rotorua, the Coromandel Penisula, the Bay of Islands and more. With an ease to transport more than 600kg of equipment, the aircraft is a perfect choice for your planned fishing outing, surfing trip, film and TV production, research as well as your desired personal and corporate observation flights Running all year round they also work on demand. Free parking for your first hour at Jellicoe Street car park. See more here . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . They provide scenic flights, island lunches, adventure trips, island-hopping experiences, island escapes and charter services over the breath-taking land of Aotearoa. Their De Havilland Beaver Floatplane comfortably seats 6 adults to breath-taking Island destinations. Scenic flights give a unique experience as you fly over the mesmerizing Hauraki Gulf Islands and volcano. Additionally you and your friends could go for an island get-away for lunch or a wine tasting on Waiheke Island. They also offer transfers, adventure trips and charter services to destinations such as Great Barrier Island, Kawau, Rakino, Rotorua, the Coromandel Penisula, the Bay of Islands and more. With an ease to transport more than 600kg of equipment, the aircraft is a perfect choice for your planned fishing outing, surfing trip, film and TV production, research as well as your desired personal and corporate observation flights Running all year round they also work on demand. Free parking for your first hour at Jellicoe Street car park. See more here . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Auckland The ultimate tandem skydive destination Add to favourites 11 Elliott Street, 0800 921 650 Website Show on map Activities Skydive Auckland offer the highest tandem skydive in New Zealand’s North Island, where you can jump from 16,500ft. Attached to your instructor you will freefall for up to 75 seconds and reach a speed of 200km/hr with stunning views of Waiheke Island, Piha Beach, Mt Ruapehu and even Mt Taranaki, as well as both the east and west coasts of New Zealand. Their large modern aircraft means you can jump with your friends and family! With free transport provided daily (subject to availability) from central Auckland, Skydive Auckland is the ultimate tandem skydive destination in New Zealand. Their central city shop is located on Elliott Street so come and watch the action on screen, book it and ask any questions that you have. Skydive Auckland is located in Parakai, West Auckland, an easy 40 minute drive from Auckland City. $2.50 per hour to a max of $12.50 on weekends and a $12.50 flat rate for weekday evenings at The Civic car park. Find out more . 10:00 am-10:00 pm Tuesday: 10:00 am-10:00 pm Wednesday: 10:00 am-10:00 pm Thursday: 10:00 am-10:00 pm Friday: 10:00 am-11:00 pm Saturday: 10:00 am-11:00 pm Sunday: 10:00 am-10:00 pm Website Show on map Activities Entertainment Activities This internationally popular phenomenon promises a vivid experience where you can become the main character of a captivating mystery. An adventure, where teams are locked in a themed room with a common goal to break out within an hour. To escape, you will need to find clues and solve unique puzzles. Suitable for all ages, Escape Masters is the perfect venue for corporate functions, parties, stag and hen nights, or a good time with family and friends. Choose your own difficulty level, select one of the themed rooms and bring a team of 2-8 people per room. Escape Masters Auckland CBD also offers an outdoor quest, where players can explore the city centre with a 2 hours fun-filled game. So get your walking shoes on, take on the newest challenge and help to solve the mystery! Escape Masters Auckland CBD has made VR games available to visitors in its lobby. From climbing Everest to slashing up the high scores on Fruit Ninja, VR offers entertainment on another level! Immerse yourself in over 40 games for you to choose from. Get $2.50 parking per hour to a maximum of $15.50 on evenings and weekends at the Downtown car park . Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Health and wellbeing Shopping Previous Next Escape Masters Get a group of friends together and test your problem-soving skills Add to favourites Level 11, 300 Queen Street, +64 9 869 2058 Opening hours Currently closed Monday: 10:00 am-10:00 pm Tuesday: 10:00 am-10:00 pm Wednesday: 10:00 am-10:00 pm Thursday: 10:00 am-10:00 pm Friday: 10:00 am-11:00 pm Saturday: 10:00 am-11:00 pm Sunday: 10:00 am-10:00 pm Website Show on map Activities Entertainment Activities This internationally popular phenomenon promises a vivid experience where you can become the main character of a captivating mystery. An adventure, where teams are locked in a themed room with a common goal to break out within an hour. To escape, you will need to find clues and solve unique puzzles. Suitable for all ages, Escape Masters is the perfect venue for corporate functions, parties, stag and hen nights, or a good time with family and friends. Choose your own difficulty level, select one of the themed rooms and bring a team of 2-8 people per room. Escape Masters Auckland CBD also offers an outdoor quest, where players can explore the city centre with a 2 hours fun-filled game. So get your walking shoes on, take on the newest challenge and help to solve the mystery! Escape Masters Auckland CBD has made VR games available to visitors in its lobby. From climbing Everest to slashing up the high scores on Fruit Ninja, VR offers entertainment on another level! Immerse yourself in over 40 games for you to choose from. Get $2.50 parking per hour to a maximum of $15.50 on evenings and weekends at the Downtown car park . Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Lab invites you to sit back and relax in the Wellness Lab's state-of-the-art 180-degree theatre, for a unique 45-minute sampling journey of three Comvita honeys. Booking your immersive honey tasting session: Tasting sessions are currently offered at 12.30pm, Thursday to Sunday Suitable for ages 12 and above Sessions can host six people at a time The cost is $20 per person If sessions are full online or you have a private group, email wellnesslab@comvita - they are happy to accommodate other tasting sessions as desired. Coin Singing Booth Chancery Square Add to favourites 47 Chancery Street, Opening hours Currently closed Monday: 12:00 pm-Late Tuesday: 12:00 pm-Late Wednesday: 12:00 pm-Late Thursday: 12:00 pm-Late Friday: 12:00 pm-2:00 am Saturday: 12:00 pm-2:00 am Sunday: 12:00 pm-Late Instagram Show on map Activities Entertainment Activities Bet you didn't know there were coin singing booths in Chancery Square! This unique karaoke set-up is super fun to stumble upon while exploring the city centre. Jump in one of the cosy booths and choose from a large selection of songs to belt out with mates. Or go solo! Since you're in a private booth, you can really let loose and sing your heart out! Park for $2.50 per hour, to a maximum of $10.50 on evenings and weekends at the Victoria St car park. Find out more . Shopping Coin Singing Booth Chancery Square Add to favourites 47 Chancery Street, Opening hours Currently closed Monday: 12:00 pm-Late Tuesday: 12:00 pm-Late Wednesday: 12:00 pm-Late Thursday: 12:00 pm-Late Friday: 12:00 pm-2:00 am Saturday: 12:00 pm-2:00 am Sunday: 12:00 pm-Late Instagram Show on map Activities Entertainment Activities Bet you didn't know there were coin singing booths in Chancery Square! This unique karaoke set-up is super fun to stumble upon while exploring the city centre. Jump in one of the cosy booths and choose from a large selection of songs to belt out with mates. Or go solo! Since you're in a private booth, you can really let loose and sing your heart out! Park for $2.50 per hour, to a maximum of $10.50 on evenings and weekends at the Victoria St car park. Find out more . Activities Entertainment Activities High Street District Chancery Square Family-friendly fun Entertainment $ Last updated: 07 September 2023 Add to favourites In the neighbourhood Queen Street Mighty Hotdog Located on Chancery Square, Mighty Hotdog serves super delicious and creative Korean-style deep-fried hotdogs. Add to favourites High Street District DosiRock An authentic eatery inspired by the taste of a Korean Mum's traditional recipes! Add to favourites High Street District Gilt Brasserie Gilt Brasserie is a bustling, vibrant restaurant serving simple, unfussy European fare. Add to favourites High Street District OBar Auckland Obar emerges as the go-to spot for the lively. This Korean bar isn't just a place to unwind; it's a haven where the energy is... Monday: 9:00 am-5:00 pm Tuesday: 9:00 am-5:00 pm Wednesday: 9:00 am-5:00 pm Thursday: 9:00 am-5:00 pm Friday: 9:00 am-5:00 pm Saturday: 9:00 am-5:00 pm Sunday: 9:00 am-5:00 pm Website Facebook Email Show on map Activities Getting Active Auckland Adventure Jet is Auckland’s supercharged thrill ride, 35 minute trips blasting around the harbour, seeing the city sights while getting an adrenaline pumping experience. Enjoy exhilarating jet boat spins, tricks and sweeping turns on a 23 seater jet boat, powered by turbocharged and supercharged engines. Jet boat trips depart hourly from Pier 3A on the Auckland waterfront, beside the Ferry Building at the bottom of Queen Street. Flat fee of $7.50 per day on weekends at Fanshawe Street carpark. Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . am-5:00 pm Thursday: 10:00 am-5:00 pm Friday: 10:00 am-5:00 pm Saturday: 10:00 am-5:00 pm Sunday: 10:00 am-5:00 pm Website Show on map Attractions Auckland Tourist Attractions Get ready for the ultimate adrenaline rush as you step out onto the SkyWalk at Auckland Sky Tower! Located 192 meters above the ground, this thrilling experience is not for the faint of heart. As you venture out onto the narrow platform, surrounded only by a safety harness, you'll feel your heart race and your palms sweat. But the view...oh, the view! It's simply breathtaking. Take in panoramic vistas of Auckland city, the harbor, and the stunning coastline. As you inch your way along the edge of the tower, you'll feel like you're floating on air. The wind rushing past your face, the sun shining down on you, and the buzz of the city below all combine to create an unforgettable experience. But it's not just the views that will take your breath away. The SkyWalk itself is a feat of engineering, with a specially designed platform that can withstand winds of up to 200 km/h. And with trained guides by your side, you'll feel safe and secure throughout the entire experience. So come on, take the leap and experience the thrill of a lifetime with the SkyWalk at Auckland Sky Tower. It's an adventure you'll never forget! Special offers at SkyWalk SkyWalk iPhone photo and video package ONGOING Now included with every SkyWalk and SkyJump adventure, your expertly captured moments in stunning portrait mode are perfect for sharing your daring leap over Waitamata Harbour on social media. Don't just take the plunge—capture it with style! Book now . $2.50 per hour to a max of $12.50 on weekends and a $12.50 flat rate for weekday evenings at The Civic car park. Find out more . Monday: 9:00 am-4:00 pm Tuesday: 9:00 am-4:00 pm Wednesday: 9:00 am-4:00 pm Thursday: 9:00 am-4:00 pm Friday: 9:00 am-4:00 pm Saturday: 9:00 am-4:00 pm Sunday: 9:00 am-4:00 pm Website Show on map Activities Only AJ Hackett Bungy can offer you this level of access to the Auckland Harbour Bridge; and this is the one and only Bridge Climb in New Zealand, coming complete with your very own tour guide. Lasting for 1 1/2 hours, this climb will have you wondering whether to look at your feet or focus on the spectacular views. Here is your chance to be Spiderman! Spanning a harbour so beautiful it brings tears to the eyes of even the most hardened, this full clamber will have you clamouring for more. Find out all the best parking and public transport offers now. As part of the Bungy experience you'll enjoy an exclusive bridge walk out to the specially-constructed and sensationally-suspended retro 'Bungy pod'. It's here you'll build up the courage to leap out over the Waitamata Harbour. Once airborne take time to enjoy the views of the harbour, that is if you can keep your eyes open long enough. Now, both the SkyWalk and SkyJump experiences include photos and videos captured on iPhones, expertly edited in portrait mode for seamless social media sharing. Auckland Vibe. Add to favourites Corner of Customs & Queen Street, Website Show on map Attractions Auckland Tourist Attractions Discover Auckland from the top deck of a classic icon. The Double Decker Discovery Tour is a guided city adventure aboard a beautifully restored Routemaster bus. This unique sightseeing experience combines Auckland’s vibrant waterfront, historic precincts, and cultural highlights with the charm of travelling in an 1960s London double-decker. This 90-minute journey immerses visitors in the stories, history, and scenery that define the heart of Auckland. See the city’s best-loved landmarks from a fresh perspective. Hear captivating stories about Auckland’s history, people, and hidden gems. Enjoy panoramic views. Capture unforgettable photo moments along the way. With live commentary, nostalgic character, and unbeatable views, the Double Decker Discovery Tour offers an authentic way to connect with Auckland — a sightseeing experience to remember. Tuesday's & Sunday's | 9am, 11am, 1.30pm & 3.30pm | $49pp Enjoy two hours of free parking or $5 evening and weekend rates. Find out more . Ride on public transport from as little as $2 each way. Find out more .
