Shopping Previous Next Auckland Whale & Dolphin Safari Discover the Hauraki Gulf Marine Park Add to favourites 175 Quay Street, 0508 365 744 Opening hours Currently open! Monday: 8:00 am-6:00 pm Tuesday: 8:00 am-6:00 pm Wednesday: 8:00 am-6:00 pm Thursday: 8:00 am-6:00 pm Friday: 8:00 am-6:00 pm Saturday: 8:00 am-6:00 pm Sunday: 8:00 am-6:00 pm Website Facebook Email Show on map Attractions Auckland Tourist Attractions The Auckland Whale & Dolphin Safari offers breathtaking tours of the Hauraki Gulf Marine Park. Experience the stunning Auckland skyline and harbour bridge, the thrill of being on the water and of course meet the gulf's resident population of whales, dolphins and seabirds. Part of the Pacific Ocean, the Hauraki Gulf covers an area of 4000 km² surrounding the Auckland and Coromandel regions. The park is full of a diverse range of rare and exotic ocean life. For example, the critically endangered Bryde’s whale is one such species that can be found in the Hauraki Gulf. Incredibly, over 25 of the 37 southern hemisphere marine mammals have been identified in the area, which makes up almost a third of the world’s population of these species. For over 14 years the Dolphin Explorer has been working closely with numerous research and educational institutions to help learn more about, understand and ultimately protect the magnificent marine-mammal life found in our waters. Book a tour today and experience the majesty of New Zealand's beautiful marine life. Flat fee of $7.50 per day on weekends at Fanshawe Street carpark. Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Health and wellbeing Shopping Previous Next Auckland Whale & Dolphin Safari Discover the Hauraki Gulf Marine Park Add to favourites 175 Quay Street, 0508 365 744 Opening hours Currently open! Monday: 8:00 am-6:00 pm Tuesday: 8:00 am-6:00 pm Wednesday: 8:00 am-6:00 pm Thursday: 8:00 am-6:00 pm Friday: 8:00 am-6:00 pm Saturday: 8:00 am-6:00 pm Sunday: 8:00 am-6:00 pm Website Facebook Email Show on map Attractions Auckland Tourist Attractions The Auckland Whale & Dolphin Safari offers breathtaking tours of the Hauraki Gulf Marine Park. Experience the stunning Auckland skyline and harbour bridge, the thrill of being on the water and of course meet the gulf's resident population of whales, dolphins and seabirds. Part of the Pacific Ocean, the Hauraki Gulf covers an area of 4000 km² surrounding the Auckland and Coromandel regions. The park is full of a diverse range of rare and exotic ocean life. For example, the critically endangered Bryde’s whale is one such species that can be found in the Hauraki Gulf. Incredibly, over 25 of the 37 southern hemisphere marine mammals have been identified in the area, which makes up almost a third of the world’s population of these species. For over 14 years the Dolphin Explorer has been working closely with numerous research and educational institutions to help learn more about, understand and ultimately protect the magnificent marine-mammal life found in our waters. Book a tour today and experience the majesty of New Zealand's beautiful marine life. Flat fee of $7.50 per day on weekends at Fanshawe Street carpark. Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Previous Next Sky Tower An icon of Auckland's city skyline Add to favourites Victoria Street West, 0800 759 2489 Opening hours Currently open! Monday: 8:30 am-10:00 pm Tuesday: 8:30 am-10:00 pm Wednesday: 8:30 am-10:00 pm Thursday: 8:30 am-10:00 pm Friday: 8:30 am-11:00 pm Saturday: 8:30 am-11:00 pm Sunday: 8:30 am-10:00 pm Website Facebook Email Show on map Attractions Auckland Tourist Attractions A truly captivating experience awaits visitors to Auckland's Sky Tower. At 328 metres, it is the tallest man-made structure in New Zealand and offers breathtaking views for up to 80 kilometres in every direction. Travel up in the glass-fronted lifts to one of the three spectacular viewing platforms, or for more thrills and excitement, SkyWalk round the pergola at 192 metres up or SkyJump off the Tower! If dining with a view is what you're after, then you're spoilt for choice with three restaurants and cafes up the Sky Tower - Orbit 360˚ Dining revolving restaurant, the superbly chic and elegant The Sugar Club or relax with your coffee, cheese board or ice cream at the Sky Café. The Sky Tower is one of New Zealand's most exhilarating and spectacular tourist attractions, you will be amazed at what you can see and do under one roof! In late 2019, the external lights on the Sky Tower were switched to LED, supporting SkyCity’s climate change commitment to reduce carbon emissions from the Sky Towers lighting by 10%. Following the upgrade, the number of external lights on the Sky Tower has doubled, with 60 LED lights at the top of the Sky Tower and 96 LED lights at the base – truly lighting up Auckland’s skyline. Upcoming Events at Sky Tower 1 result 31 DEC 2025 | 9PM - 2AM House in the Clouds Celebrate a dazzling New Year's Eve party to remember and welcome 2026 above the clouds at the Sky Tower! Previous Next Sky Tower An icon of Auckland's city skyline Add to favourites Victoria Street West, 0800 759 2489 Opening hours Currently open! Monday: 8:30 am-10:00 pm Tuesday: 8:30 am-10:00 pm Wednesday: 8:30 am-10:00 pm Thursday: 8:30 am-10:00 pm Friday: 8:30 am-11:00 pm Saturday: 8:30 am-11:00 pm Sunday: 8:30 am-10:00 pm Website Facebook Email Show on map Attractions Auckland Tourist Attractions A truly captivating experience awaits visitors to Auckland's Sky Tower. At 328 metres, it is the tallest man-made structure in New Zealand and offers breathtaking views for up to 80 kilometres in every direction. Travel up in the glass-fronted lifts to one of the three spectacular viewing platforms, or for more thrills and excitement, SkyWalk round the pergola at 192 metres up or SkyJump off the Tower! If dining with a view is what you're after, then you're spoilt for choice with three restaurants and cafes up the Sky Tower - Orbit 360˚ Dining revolving restaurant, the superbly chic and elegant The Sugar Club or relax with your coffee, cheese board or ice cream at the Sky Café. The Sky Tower is one of New Zealand's most exhilarating and spectacular tourist attractions, you will be amazed at what you can see and do under one roof! In late 2019, the external lights on the Sky Tower were switched to LED, supporting SkyCity’s climate change commitment to reduce carbon emissions from the Sky Towers lighting by 10%. Following the upgrade, the number of external lights on the Sky Tower has doubled, with 60 LED lights at the top of the Sky Tower and 96 LED lights at the base – truly lighting up Auckland’s skyline. Upcoming Events at Sky Tower 1 result 31 DEC 2025 | 9PM - 2AM House in the Clouds Celebrate a dazzling New Year's Eve party to remember and welcome 2026 above the clouds at the Sky Tower! Add to favourites $2.50 per hour to a max of $12.50 on weekends and a $12.50 flat rate for weekday evenings at The Civic car park. Find out more . Great Escape on Lorne Street Add to favourites 28 Lorne Street, 021 0830 7230 Opening hours Currently closed Monday: Closed Tuesday: Closed Wednesday: 2:00 pm-Late Thursday: 2:00 pm-Late Friday: 2:00 pm-Late Saturday: 11:00 am-Late Sunday: 11:00 am-Late Website Email Show on map Activities Entertainment Activities Great Escape is a fun and simple, yet challenging real life escape game. Your team of 3 to 7 friends, family or co-workers are locked in a themed room. You have 1 hour to escape using nothing but your wits and intellect, creativity and common sense, plus a lot of teamwork! Don’t worry, it’s not scary at all. It’s all about the buzz of solving clues and puzzles. There’s even an emergency button should you need it. But we would recommend pushing through - there's nothing like cracking the puzzle for yourself and breaking free. $2.50 per hour to a max of $12.50 on weekends and a $12.50 flat rate for weekday evenings at The Civic car park. Find out more . The newly designed and invigorated Odysseum is the brainchild of founders and creatives, David Parker-Smith and Michelle Moray-Cook. The 100% New Zealand made, owned and operated, experience boasts next level excitement for all ages - from the young to the young at heart. Odyssey Sensory Maze Odyssey is an amazing adventure where while trying to find your way out you will experience darker challenging spaces and quirky obstacles, illusions, crazy lighting effects, scents, weird sounds and strange sensations that will leave you with an experience that you will never forget! Odyssey is fun for all ages, great family entertainment and definitely a must see for all tourists! The incredible journey through odyssey takes around 20 minutes, however there is not time limit to your adventure and you are free to discover Odyssey at your own pace. Odyssey is recommended for those aged 8 and over but if you would like to enquire about how suitable Odyssey is for your young ones, get in touch with Odyssey Sensory Maze here . Doom Room NZ's Doom Room is coming soon! Can you survive 6.66 seconds in the darkness? In the Doom Room, the feat of the unknown comes out to play. Where monsters of many nightmares are lurking out of sight.. until they smell your fear. Get $2.50 parking per hour to a maximum of $15.50 on evenings and weekends at the Downtown car park . Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . 11:00 am-1:00 am Friday: 11:00 am-2:00 am Saturday: 11:00 am-2:00 am Sunday: 11:00 am-Late Facebook Show on map Activities Entertainment Activities Calling all pool enthusiasts! Beneath the vibrant streets of Auckland lies Cue City - a hidden haven for pool and billiards enthusiasts! Whether you're seeking a laid-back evening with friends or a competitive showdown, Cue City is the go-to spot for an unforgettable experience. Make your evening plans extraordinary – gather your crew and head to Cue City on Queen Street. It's more than a pool hall; it's an underground sanctuary for billiards aficionados, where every shot holds the promise of victory, and every moment is a celebration. Join in for an evening of cue-induced excitement and memories in the making! Previous Next See here for more activities in the city centre Get $2.50 parking per hour to a maximum of $15.50 on evenings and weekends at the Downtown car park . Find out more . am-Late Thursday: 11:00 am-1:00 am Friday: 11:00 am-2:00 am Saturday: 11:00 am-2:00 am Sunday: 11:00 am-Late Facebook Show on map Activities Entertainment Activities Calling all pool enthusiasts! Beneath the vibrant streets of Auckland lies Cue City - a hidden haven for pool and billiards enthusiasts! Whether you're seeking a laid-back evening with friends or a competitive showdown, Cue City is the go-to spot for an unforgettable experience. Make your evening plans extraordinary – gather your crew and head to Cue City on Queen Street. It's more than a pool hall; it's an underground sanctuary for billiards aficionados, where every shot holds the promise of victory, and every moment is a celebration. Join in for an evening of cue-induced excitement and memories in the making! Previous Next See here for more activities in the city centre Get $2.50 parking per hour to a maximum of $15.50 on evenings and weekends at the Downtown car park . Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Wednesday: 11:00 am-10:00 pm Thursday: 11:00 am-10:00 pm Friday: 11:00 am-10:00 pm Saturday: 9:00 am-10:00 pm Sunday: 10:30 am-9:30 pm Website Facebook Email Show on map Attractions Auckland Tourist Attractions The phenomenon of live escape games has already hit the USA, Asia, Europe and Australia, enjoy Escapade's version with a distinct Kiwi flavour. Forget video games, this is a physical, real-life game that will have your brain working overtime. At Escapade, you’re locked in a room, there’s a mystery to be solved, and the clock’s ticking! Using your observational skills, problem solving ability, street smarts and common sense, you need to decipher a set of tricky clues and puzzles as you and your team race to find the answers and escape in just 60 minutes. Escapade is great for groups of friends, businesses seeking fresh team-building activities, visitors from around the country, and tourists looking for a fun slice of Kiwi culture. The post-challenge lounge area also features a bar, as well as extra puzzles and challenges if you’re keen for more. NEW GAME: Galactic Cantina The Cantina is a strange and mysterious den on a far-off space station, and you're in big trouble ... the space cartel has got wind you've been trading on their patch - and you need to escape the space station right now! 2-6 people $57 Previous Next $2.50 per hour to a max of $12.50 on weekends and a $12.50 flat rate for weekday evenings at The Civic car park. Find out more . Metrolanes Bowling Test out your bowling skills Add to favourites 291 - 297 Queen St, Auckland CBD, 09 377 6737 Opening hours Currently closed Monday: 12:00 pm-Late Tuesday: 12:00 pm-Late Wednesday: 12:00 pm-Late Thursday: 12:00 pm-Late Friday: 12:00 pm-Late Saturday: 12:00 pm-Late Sunday: 12:00 pm-Late Website Facebook Show on map Activities Entertainment Activities Metrolanes represents the next generation in entertainment with 12 full size Tenpin Bowling lanes, that are uniquely split into 3 areas. A full bar complete with a large selection of cocktails, wines and spirits, and a restaurant that features a chef inspired menu. In the mezzanine area you can find 4 smaller lanes for mini bowling that both kids and adults can enjoy. The space is also perfect for children's parties. The absolute latest in sound and lighting is featured throughout the venue and a luxurious interior, including leather sofas and plush seating, makes Metrolanes an environment for everyone to enjoy, no matter your age or ability. There is also a stunning deck area overlooking Aotea Square and direct access to the centre from Queen St, Aotea Square, or Level 3 opposite Event Cinema inside the Metro Building. If you're looking for a place to hold your next corporate function, check out the special packages that Metrolanes offer. Perfect for a fun day out with your colleagues. $2.50 per hour to a max of $12.50 on weekends and a $12.50 flat rate for weekday evenings at The Civic car park. Find out more . is New Zealand's first self-taking photography studio. Their space is set up with all the equipment you need for a proper photo sesh! Camera, lighting, props, and backdrop are all provided. The camera is connected to a remote clicker so you and your friends, family or party can go crazy and have fun without a stranger or photographer taking the photos for you. This allows you to be yourself and capture the real you. Book now! Park for $2.50 per hour, to a maximum of $10.50 on evenings and weekends at the Victoria St car park. Find out more . Shopping Studio Self New Zealand's first self-taking photography studio Add to favourites 2 Durham Street East, 0210 880 0320 Opening hours Currently closed Monday: 10:00 am-6:00 pm Tuesday: 10:00 am-6:00 pm Wednesday: 10:00 am-6:00 pm Thursday: 10:00 am-6:00 pm Friday: 10:00 am-6:00 pm Saturday: 10:00 am-5:00 pm Sunday: 10:00 am-5:00 pm Instagram Book now Show on map Activities Entertainment Activities Studio Self is New Zealand's first self-taking photography studio. Their space is set up with all the equipment you need for a proper photo sesh! Camera, lighting, props, and backdrop are all provided. The camera is connected to a remote clicker so you and your friends, family or party can go crazy and have fun without a stranger or photographer taking the photos for you. This allows you to be yourself and capture the real you. Book now! Park for $2.50 per hour, to a maximum of $10.50 on evenings and weekends at the Victoria St car park. Find out more . Monday: 9:00 am-4:00 am Tuesday: 9:00 am-4:00 am Wednesday: 9:00 am-4:00 am Thursday: 9:00 am-4:00 am Friday: 9:00 am-4:00 am Saturday: 9:00 am-4:00 am Sunday: 9:00 am-4:00 am Website Show on map Bars and Nightlife Pubs The QF Tavern is a great little Kiwi pub in the heart of Auckland city and is a must visit for those looking for a Kiwi experience. With all major sports events shown on the large screen supported by four flat screen tv's all with full surround sound, the QF Tavern is your place for game night! Great for lunch, dinner, drinks or even an afternoon coffee, call in and make yourself known to the friendly staff. Get $2.50 parking per hour to a maximum of $15.50 on evenings and weekends at the Downtown car park . Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Pointers Bar & Grill It´s a place that believes that less is more. The theory is simple and pretty clear cut Add to favourites 1 Lower Hobson Street, Auckland CBD, Opening hours Currently closed Monday: Closed Tuesday: 3:00 pm-10:00 pm Wednesday: 3:00 pm-4:00 am Thursday: 3:00 pm-10:00 pm Friday: 3:00 pm-4:00 am Saturday: 10:00 pm-4:00 am Sunday: Closed Facebook Show on map Bars and Nightlife Clubs Pointers Bar & Grill is good, honest, fun. The relaxed, casual environment makes it almost like having friends over to your place. It is a great place to catch up with friends for some drinks and for live music. It’s a blend of non-pretentious people who are not particularly impressed by the club scene. $2.50 per hour to a max of $12.50 on weekends and a $12.50 flat rate for weekday evenings at The Civic car park. Find out more . Shopping (Photo: Sacha Stejko) Previous Next Auckland Art Gallery Toi o Tāmaki - NZ's most extensive collection of national and international art. Add to favourites Corner Kitchener and Wellesley Streets, +64 9 379 1349 Opening hours Currently closed Monday: 10:00 am-5:00 pm Tuesday: 10:00 am-5:00 pm Wednesday: 10:00 am-5:00 pm Thursday: 10:00 am-5:00 pm Friday: 10:00 am-5:00 pm Saturday: 10:00 am-5:00 pm Sunday: 10:00 am-5:00 pm Website Facebook Email Show on map Attractions Auckland Tourist Attractions History, heritage and culture are brought to life at Auckland Art Gallery Toi o Tāmaki. Founded in 1888, it remains New Zealand’s largest visual arts experience. The building is striking with beautiful Kauri columns and a canopy that stand tall above you as you approach the building. The renovation of the building in 2011 resulted in an award for the building as World Building of the Year at the World Architecture Festival. The light-filled North Atrium continues to draw people to enjoy views out to Queen Street, and there are glimpses of Albert Park visible from some of the gallery floors. There's lots to explore at the gallery. The Learning Centre has great resources related to the exhibitions that come to the gallery and the Auckland Art Gallery shop has a great range of exclusive art gifts including reproductions and publications. There are regular tours of the building, as well as permanent collections and temporary exhibitions from major international galleries. There are regular family-friendly events and events associated with regular exhibitions. The Auckland Art Gallery also has a hidden gem - a theatre that often shows arthouse films. Add to favourites Corner Kitchener and Wellesley Streets, +64 9 379 1349 Opening hours Currently closed Monday: 10:00 am-5:00 pm Tuesday: 10:00 am-5:00 pm Wednesday: 10:00 am-5:00 pm Thursday: 10:00 am-5:00 pm Friday: 10:00 am-5:00 pm Saturday: 10:00 am-5:00 pm Sunday: 10:00 am-5:00 pm Website Facebook Email Show on map Attractions Auckland Tourist Attractions History, heritage and culture are brought to life at Auckland Art Gallery Toi o Tāmaki. Founded in 1888, it remains New Zealand’s largest visual arts experience. The building is striking with beautiful Kauri columns and a canopy that stand tall above you as you approach the building. The renovation of the building in 2011 resulted in an award for the building as World Building of the Year at the World Architecture Festival. The light-filled North Atrium continues to draw people to enjoy views out to Queen Street, and there are glimpses of Albert Park visible from some of the gallery floors. There's lots to explore at the gallery. The Learning Centre has great resources related to the exhibitions that come to the gallery and the Auckland Art Gallery shop has a great range of exclusive art gifts including reproductions and publications. There are regular tours of the building, as well as permanent collections and temporary exhibitions from major international galleries. There are regular family-friendly events and events associated with regular exhibitions. The Auckland Art Gallery also has a hidden gem - a theatre that often shows arthouse films. Tuesday: 11:00 am-Late Wednesday: 11:00 am-Late Thursday: 11:00 am-Late Friday: 11:00 am-1:00 am Saturday: 10:00 am-1:00 am Sunday: 10:00 am-Late Website Show on map Bars and Nightlife Bars Holey Moley is a golf club concept bar that brings its distinctive style of fun in the form of a multi-sensory labyrinth mini golf course, combined with an extensive range of drinks (including lolly themed cocktails) and delicious food. And we haven't even mentioned it now offers arguably the most gorgeous karaoke bar Auckland has ever seen too! The venue sprawls two storeys and boasts 27 themed golf holes. Live DJs perform while two bars will serve the best craft beers and mouth-watering cocktails. In-between rounds and hydration breaks, a full-service kitchen boasts a menu of burgers, loaded fries and bar snacks, fit to refuel the hungriest of clubbers. Providing Instagram-worthy backdrops and drool-worthy treats, Holey Moley is perfect for a unique, hilarious night out with friends. If you just Wanna Dance With Somebody , Holey Moley has the solution. Their new private room upstairs is home to the best new karaoke bar Auckland has to offer, that will ensure you have the Time of your Life . This isn’t your usual karaoke room that has you Dancin’ In The Dar k in a dingy basement somewhere, this one features large windows that actually overlook the Viaduct Harbour! An hour of karaoke for up to 20 people will set you back $100. Spotlight on ... Happy Hour Holey Moley Golf Club and Karaoke Room Join Holey Moley from 4-6pm every day for a happy hour that's sure to hit the spot after a hard day's work. From bevvies to tasty bites, it's an end of day treat not to be missed. $5 Tacos | $7 Wines & Spirits | $7 Packaged Beers | $12 Cocktails No reservations needed—just walk in and enjoy! Student Deal Holey Moley Golf Club and Karaoke Room Hey students! Enjoy a round of mini golf any day of the week for just $12. Just verify your student details through UNiDAYS to receive your unique code and book here . Family Deal Holey Moley Golf Club and Karaoke Room Families can enjoy 9 holes of mini golf for just $50 at Holey Moley using the code FAMILYFUN . The offer applies to 1 adult + 3 kids or 2 adults + 2 kids, with extra participants charged at the standard rate. A maximum of 2 sessions can be booked under this deal. Click here to book your spot. Kids Deal Holey Moley Golf Club and Karaoke Room All day everyday, single games of Mini Golf are $14 for kids! Book here . Bottomless Brunch Holey Moley Golf Club and Karaoke Room Bottomless Brunch has landed at Holey Moley Viaduct and it's a guaranteed showstopper for your next midday boozy bash. For just $59pp get bottomless drinks, unlimited fries, a duo of tacos and unlimited mini golf—it doesn't get more generous than that! Available Saturdays, Sundays and public holidays. Click here to book a sitting. Flat fee of $7.50 per day on weekends at Fanshawe Street carpark. Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . favourites 204 Quay Street, 0800 727 833 Opening hours Currently closed Monday: 11:00 am-Late Tuesday: 11:00 am-Late Wednesday: 11:00 am-Late Thursday: 11:00 am-Late Friday: 11:00 am-1:00 am Saturday: 10:00 am-1:00 am Sunday: 10:00 am-Late Website Show on map Bars and Nightlife Bars Holey Moley is a golf club concept bar that brings its distinctive style of fun in the form of a multi-sensory labyrinth mini golf course, combined with an extensive range of drinks (including lolly themed cocktails) and delicious food. And we haven't even mentioned it now offers arguably the most gorgeous karaoke bar Auckland has ever seen too! The venue sprawls two storeys and boasts 27 themed golf holes. Live DJs perform while two bars will serve the best craft beers and mouth-watering cocktails. In-between rounds and hydration breaks, a full-service kitchen boasts a menu of burgers, loaded fries and bar snacks, fit to refuel the hungriest of clubbers. Providing Instagram-worthy backdrops and drool-worthy treats, Holey Moley is perfect for a unique, hilarious night out with friends. If you just Wanna Dance With Somebody , Holey Moley has the solution. Their new private room upstairs is home to the best new karaoke bar Auckland has to offer, that will ensure you have the Time of your Life . This isn’t your usual karaoke room that has you Dancin’ In The Dar k in a dingy basement somewhere, this one features large windows that actually overlook the Viaduct Harbour! An hour of karaoke for up to 20 people will set you back $100. Spotlight on ... Happy Hour Holey Moley Golf Club and Karaoke Room Join Holey Moley from 4-6pm every day for a happy hour that's sure to hit the spot after a hard day's work. From bevvies to tasty bites, it's an end of day treat not to be missed. $5 Tacos | $7 Wines & Spirits | $7 Packaged Beers | $12 Cocktails No reservations needed—just walk in and enjoy! Student Deal Holey Moley Golf Club and Karaoke Room Hey students! Enjoy a round of mini golf any day of the week for just $12. Just verify your student details through UNiDAYS to receive your unique code and book here . Family Deal Holey Moley Golf Club and Karaoke Room Families can enjoy 9 holes of mini golf for just $50 at Holey Moley using the code FAMILYFUN . The offer applies to 1 adult + 3 kids or 2 adults + 2 kids, with extra participants charged at the standard rate. A maximum of 2 sessions can be booked under this deal. Click here to book your spot. Kids Deal Holey Moley Golf Club and Karaoke Room All day everyday, single games of Mini Golf are $14 for kids! Book here . Bottomless Brunch Holey Moley Golf Club and Karaoke Room Bottomless Brunch has landed at Holey Moley Viaduct and it's a guaranteed showstopper for your next midday boozy bash. For just $59pp get bottomless drinks, unlimited fries, a duo of tacos and unlimited mini golf—it doesn't get more generous than that! Available Saturdays, Sundays and public holidays. Click here to book a sitting. Flat fee of $7.50 per day on weekends at Fanshawe Street carpark. Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Saturday: 5:00 pm-4:00 am Sunday: Closed Facebook Show on map Bars and Nightlife Clubs Come experience delicious cocktails and live music from Wednesday to Saturday from 8pm. Hand selected solo artists will take you back in time with timeless jazz classics on Wednesday and Thursday from 8pm till Late. On Friday and Saturday you will be transported back to late 90s clubbing scene. Get $2.50 parking per hour to a maximum of $15.50 on evenings and weekends at the Downtown car park . Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . dance music space Add to favourites 151 Queen Street, Website Facebook Email Show on map Bars and Nightlife Live Music The Mothership is a popular live music venue and dance music space located in the heart of the city. Boasting the heaviest club system in Auckland, The Mothership is known for its intimate atmosphere, top-quality sound system, and diverse lineup of local and international acts. The venue has a capacity of around 300 people, making it an ideal spot for fans who want to get up close and personal with their favorite artists. The venue is popular among both established and up-and-coming musicians, with a focus on indie, rock, and electronic genres. Previous Next Park for $2.50 per hour, to a maximum of $10.50 on evenings and weekends at the Victoria St car park. Find out more . Previous Next The Brewers Co-Operative Craft beer and delicious food Add to favourites 128-132 Victoria Street West, +64 9-309 4515 Opening hours Currently closed Monday: 11:30 am-10:00 pm Tuesday: 11:30 am-10:00 pm Wednesday: 11:30 am-10:00 pm Thursday: 11:30 am-10:00 pm Friday: 11:30 am-10:00 pm Saturday: 11:30 am-10:00 pm Sunday: 11:30 am-10:00 pm Website Email Show on map Bars and Nightlife The Brewers Co-operative is a bar and eatery serving delicious Kiwi craft beer and perfectly cooked fish & chips. With a focus on quality craft beer The Brewers Co-operative sticks to labels that brew enthusiasts will know and love with new flavours being brought in regularly. You can enjoy tastings at this comfortable eatery from Good George, Garage Project, Epic and Liberty - amongst others. The Brewers Co-op kitchen provides delicious comfort food - with an emphasis on the classic Kiwi combination of fish and chips. For customers looking for a more intimate space, The Brewers Loft, located on the level above the main bar, is available for private function hire, including beer and food tasting forums. $7.50 flat parking rate on weekends at the Fanshawe St car park. Find out more . Kids ride free on public transport on weekends and public holidays. Find out more . Bars and Nightlife Victoria Park Last updated: 02 August 2022 Add to favourites In the neighbourhood Victoria Park The Empire Tavern The Empire Tavern is one of Auckland's leading entertainment venues, with one of the best garden bars in Auckland located at... Add to favourites Victoria Park Ramada Suites Victoria Street Add to favourites Federal & Elliott Palm Cafe If you're looking for authentic Vietnamese cuisine in the city centre, Palm Cafe is a great place to find yourself! Add to favourites Scratch Bakers Catering Try out some delicious treats from Scratch Bakers for your upcoming morning tea or lunch meeting at work.
